La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
La socia Anacleta agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Anacleta, continues to belong to the “IMASUMAC II” Communal Bank. She continues to be dedicated to providing transportation services to tourists for different tour companies that request her services, such as Valle Sagrado and City Tours, among others.

This member has been engaged in this business for some time. It is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. The member wants to be able to continue her business so that she can continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase tires for her car.

Anaclete is grateful for the support she has received and is committed to making her loan payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her car.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se dedica al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes ferias y mercados,la socia tambien tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz y papa,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina farms and raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens to sell at various fairs and markets. She also has a plot of land where she grows corn and potatoes. She wants to build her farming and animal-raising businesses. She has applied for a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens. She is happy to have funding and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Fe Y Confianza Group

texts.es: El grupo fe y confianza está hecho por tres socios muy trabajadores uno de ellos es Mauricio tiene la edad de 49 años, casado, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la compra y venta de res, en la zonas rurales  además destaza cerdo en pie  en la subasta de Tipitapa. Tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 22 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de reces y cerdo en pie. Guadalupe tiene 59 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon y Arabela, Socorro tiene la edad de 54 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
The group "Fe Y Confianza" (Faith and Trust) consists of three hardworking members. One of them is Mauricio. He is 49 years old, married, and has three dependent children. His business involves buying and selling cattle in the rural areas. Mauricio also sells butchered pigs at an auction in Tipitapa. He has been in business for 22 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy live cattle and pigs.

Guadalupe is 59 years old and in the business of selling Avon and Arabela cosmetics. Socorro is 54 years old and has a business of selling clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 21 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail store where he sells bags. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. 

He will use the 8,700 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a 1,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 liter water tank for domestic use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 43 years old and married.  She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a 5000-litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will open a wholesale business.

loans.use: buy a 5,000-litre tank to store clean water at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 1,000 liter water tank.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and married with 4 children between the ages 3 years and 12 years. She runs a local food business in Tombo, in the Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to strive for her survival. 

She began this business just after she got married.  She sells local fast food within her community. She says that the major problem with her business is slow sales during the rainy season.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cassava, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cassava, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu who is in her late forties and is from Tombo, western rural area in Freetown. She is widowed with three children. Her children are going to school. After the war, Isatu established her rubber slippers business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week moving around the community to sell her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more rubber slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 52-year-old married man. He has eight children with ages ranging from five years to 28 years. He describes himself as God-fearing. He operates a restaurant where he sells cooked food. He has been involved in this business for for over 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

He will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a 2300 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will open more businesses.

loans.use: buy a 2300 liter water tank.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 59-year-old married woman. She has 9 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself as humble. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She describes her family challenge to be poor water storage facilities and poor water supply. 

She will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a 1,000 liter water tank.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 54-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 14 to 26. He describes himself to be God-fearing. 

He operates a farm where he grows sugarcane, maize, etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

He will use the Kes 15,600 loan to buy a 2,300 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

He hopes that in the future he will open more businesses.

loans.use: to buy a 2,300 litre water tank.

loans.name: Phidence

texts.en:
Phidence is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 6 and 13 years. She describes herself to be open-minded. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She describes her family challenge to be the shortage of water. 

She will use the Kes 11,100 loan to buy a 1,500 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a 1,500 liter water tank.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana de 56 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos de 7 años, 5 años y 4 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado muy duro para ganarse la vida y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Juana se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos dicho oficio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su vivienda es su único patrimonio la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Con el deseo de dar mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared que le permita cerrar un cuarto. Con el crédito comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con dicho crédito y comenzar a construir lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old and a single mother of three children, ages 7, 5 and 4. She has worked hard her entire life to make a living and give her family better living conditions. Juana works providing domestic services, which she says is her main source of income. Through a lot of effort, Juana was able to build her own home, which she says is her only asset.

Juana is requesting this loan from the field partner because she wants to make her family safer and more comfortable. She will invest it in the construction of a wall, which will allow her to enclose a room in her house. Juana will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron bars. She hopes to receive the loan and start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron bars to build a wall to enclose a room in her home.

loans.name: Gorreth

texts.en:
Gorreth is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the  region of Masaka in Uganda. She has two children, who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Gorreth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which deals in various home products. 

To help expand her business, Gorreth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase business capital, and will help Gorreth to generate greater profits and save money for school fees. Gorreth hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her standards of living. 

Gorreth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorreth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to increase business capital in her retail store.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 40-year-old, married father of two children, who has been working in selling coffee and hot drinks since February 2012.

Rami is a hard worker; he used to work as an electrician but the increasing family needs made him change his working sector to a daily income business, which he is doing fine with.

Rami is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a new updated espresso coffee machine, which is very important for developing his business and providing his customers with specially made coffee and hot drinks.

Rami is working hard to open a new coffee shop in the future instead of the current rented small place he is working in.

loans.use: to buy a new updated espresso coffee machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old and lives in the town of Arua in Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, in which she sells material for clothes. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for the business and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and increase business capital. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the family welfare. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more material for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Milo (cocoa drink) to sell.

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es:
El socio Yedi continua brindando el servicio de taxi, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 10:00pm, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yedi, our client, continues to provide his taxi service. He has done well in the time he dedicates to this activity thanks to the efforts he puts in everyday for this job. He works from 6 am to 10 pm. He is responsible and determined and wants to continue working in this way to continue to support his family. 
The client is requesting a loan to pay for his car's maintenance. 
He is grateful for the loan and promises to meet all of his repayment requirements.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance for his taxi.

loans.name: Kumbah

texts.en:
Kumbah is 49 years old, married, and lives in the community surrounding Airport of Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has six children, with ages between 25 and 17. Only one is living at home and attending school. 

For the past ten years Kumbah has been involved in business, and currently she is selling used clothes, grease, body cream, etc. from a small provision shop. She uses the bus most of the time to get her supplies to her shop. 

She likes how her customers can buy from her and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family. She learned business from other local businesswomen. Kumbah is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes, grease, body cream, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, grease, body cream, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 29 years old and she lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is married. Her husband is a house builder and they have four children between 10 months old and 10 years old. Three of her children are in school and they all live at home. 

Cecelia has been selling fish for the past ten years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for the business. Her dream is to improve her business to a shop business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for domestic use

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa, con 58 años de edad y madre de 2 hijos, hasta hace aproximadamente 2 años era un ama de casa dedicada a su familia pero, gracias a los conocimientos que obtuvo en una capacitación sobre confección que recibió en su congregación religiosa, ella inició su propio taller en el que presta el servicio a terceros y también confecciona su línea propia de Leggins, trabaja sola de lunes a viernes de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm o dependiendo del volumen de trabajo que tenga; de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos económicos suficientes para su sustento diario, pues la carga económica recayó totalmente sobre ella luego de quedar viuda tras la muerte de su esposo. Con esfuerzo y resignación ha sobrepasado sus momentos difíciles de tristeza, pero diariamente se levanta motivada por la necesidad de distraerse y sentirse útil, al mismo tiempo que genera recursos para sobrevivir. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, entre otros) que requiere para la elaboración de conjuntos deportivos y leggins, para cumplir con las entregas en el momento oportuno y así tener la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor. De esta forma, Rosa sueña seguir adelante y cada día esforzarse más para sacar adelante su negocio y poder cumplir el sueño de realizar mejoras estructurales en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y una vejez más digna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 58, has two children and, up until the last two years, was a homemaker dedicated to her family. Thanks to the skills she learned in a sewing class sponsored by her local church group, she opened her own workshop, where she offers service to customers and makes her own line of leggings. She works alone from Monday to Friday from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., depending on the amount of work she has. She is able to earn enough to support her household, as she is financially responsible for everything since her husband died. 

With effort and determination, she has overcome sad moments. Every day she gets up motivated by the need to keep busy and feel useful while earning enough to survive. She has applied for a loan to buy wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and more) to make sport sets and leggings to fill orders on time and to increase her sales and income. Rosa dreams of moving ahead and working harder each day to make her business prosper and to achieve her goal of making improvements to her house, which will allow her to live in better conditions and have a more dignified old age.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and more).

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 32-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a grinding mill where he grinds maize to produce maize flour for sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Alex will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. His business goal is to expand his business over the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for use at home.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 11 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a 2,300 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a 2,300 litre water tank to use at home.

loans.name: Adamasay

texts.en:
Adamasay is in her late 30's, and married with 4 children between the age of 4 and 13. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started the business because she wants to improve the condition of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war, and sells glass cups, knifes, and food containers in her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is an improper business location.

Adamasay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell. 

She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 23 years old; she lives in the community surrounding Robert International Airport. She is a ninth grade drop-out. She is now living with a boyfriend and they have three children so far. Their children are between 2 and 10 years old, who live with them and attend school. She started her business two years ago with a small amount of money from her mother. 

Marie has requested 9,000 LRD to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She hopes in the future to possess her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: G.s Rio Grande#3 Group

texts.es:
La  señora Juana  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con    sus   hijos  y su  esposo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  mini pulpería desde hace más de 9  años.
Doña Juana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de churros,  refrescos,  pan, café,  azúcar, maíz,  frijoles, etc. Con el crédito  espera  un aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco para ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña Juana al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan cubrir sus necesidades y también que mejore un poco su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona de  donde vive y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia.  
Don Victoriano su negocio es pulpería  desde hace 13 años 
Doña Anita su negocio es la  pulpería desde hace 10 años.
Doña Reyna su negocio es la elaboración y venta  de tortillas desde hace 13 años


Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre  del 2013
texts.en:
Juana is a very enterprising person who lives with her children and her husband in a community in southern Honduras. Her business for more than 9 years is a mini grocery store.  Doña Juana needs the loan to purchase churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc.  She hopes to increase her sales with this credit because with the capital she will be able to offer fresh goods to the customers who visit the store.

Juana, like her companions in the group, hopes to cover their necessities and also to improve their economic situation a bit; this investment reflects that.  She dreams that in a few years her business will be positioned as the largest and best known in the area where she lives, and that she will be able to continue supporting her family.

Other members of the group include:
Victoriano whose business of 13 years is a grocery. 
Anita whose business of 10 years is a grocery.
Reyna whose business of 13 years is the making and selling of tortillas.  

Choluteca, Honduras –  October 2013

loans.use: to purchase churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc. for their business.

loans.name: Los Cisnes Group

texts.es: Teresa, quien aparece con una amplia sonrisa al fondo vestida de negro y en medio de la fotografía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Cisnes, de Castro. En este Banco Comunal los rubros más importantes son la venta de ropa usada, tejidos, negocio de abarrotes, venta de joyas de fantasía, y venta de verduras. Teresa vende ropa americana, lo hace casi un año, y empezó solo por necesidad, y cuando empezó le iba muy bien pero ha habido días difíciles en donde ha vendido nada. El préstamo que solicita será para comprar ropa nueva, ya que tiene clientas que le han solicitado, es un gran desafío que ella tiene y espera que le vaya muy bien con la venta de ropa nueva. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrara apoyo y ayuda.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank Los Cisnes in Castro.  She can be seen in the photo at the back in the middle, with a broad smile and dressed in black.  The most important lines of business in this organization are the sale of second-hand clothes, cloth, groceries, imitation jewelrey and vegetables.  

Teresa has been selling American clothes for almost a year.  She started out of necessity, but when she started things went quite well, although she has had hard days when she has not sold anything.  The loan she is asking for is to buy new clothes because she has customers who have been asking for it.  It is a great challenge for her and she hopes that she will enjoy success with the sale of new clothes.  What she has liked the most about working alongside Fondo Esperanza is the support and help that she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Heri Group

texts.en:
Jesca, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one daughter, who goes to school.  

She has been running a business of selling different items door to door, things like clothes, earrings, and necklaces.  She has been in this business for three years now.  She works from 12 noon to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jesca's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her stock of clothes, earrings, and necklaces.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses.  She is happy with the loan.  

She will use this loan to buy more clothes, earrings, and necklaces to resell. She dreams of owning a shop where she can sell her products.

Jesca will share this loan with her loan group, HERI, which has 10 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy more clothes, earrings, and necklaces to resell.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина женщина скотовод. Она занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота у себя во дворе дома. Она занимается этой деятельностью последние два года. Парвина замужем, ей 26 лет. У нее есть 3-летняя дочь и 1,8-летний сын. Она живет со своей маленькой семьей в районе Гиссар. Парвина в основном разводит дойные коровы, потому что она получает прибыль и с продажи молока и с продажи мяса. Парвина ценит свой бизнес, так как за счет животных она обеспечивает семью и полезными молочными продуктами и доходом. Сейчас она запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Parvina is a woman herder. She is engaged in raising cattle in the yard of her home. She has been involved in this activity for the last two years. Parvina is married and is 26 years old. She has a 3-year-old daughter and 1.8-year old son. She lives with her small family in the Gissar region.

Parvina mainly raises dairy cows, because she receives an income both from the sale of milk and meat. Parvina values her work since through the animals she supports the family both with useful dairy products and income.

Now, she is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow and to increase her headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow with the aim of increasing her count of cattle

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El señor Justo vive en la población villa 14 de Septiembre del municipio de Entre Ríos, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos a los cuales cuida y apoya en su educación. Se dedica al sector agrícola y trabaja en su propio terreno, actualmente produce cítricos y palta que los vende a los intermediarios que vienen a comprar al lugar de cosecha, la actividad es familiar pero también contrata personal eventual que le colabora en el mantenimiento y en la cosecha de los productos. Su parcela de cítrico le genera buenos ingresos económicos y es de fácil manejo por lo cual solicita un crédito de Bs. 10200 para el mantenimiento de su producción y así obtener mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Señor Justo lives in the community of Villa 14 de Septiembre in the municipality of Entre Ríos with his wife and their two children whom they are raising and educating. Justo is a farmer and works his own land where he grows citrus fruit and avocados which he sells to traders who visit the area at harvest time. Justo's family helps with the farm but he also hires workers to help with fieldwork and the harvest.

His citrus farm brings in a good income and is easy to manage so Justo is seeking a loan of Bs.10200 to provide care for his citrus farm and obtain better harvests.

loans.use: Provide care for his citrus crop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Please meet Emma, who is 49 years old and from Liberia. She lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is married to a driver.  She did not attend school.  She has ten children, 7 years to 32 years old; only six are in school and live at home. 

For the past 20 years Emma has been selling frozen food such as fish, chicken, and pig feet. She started this business with a small amount from her husband. She learned this business from her aunty. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, chicken, and pig feet for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family

loans.use: to purchase more fish, chicken, and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Kasyoro Group

texts.en:
Kasyoro group is a new group located in a rural area at Kagamba, in the Ntungamo district. It’s a women's initiative, and its members' major activity is farming. Many of the members are married, and their children are in school. 

They applied for loan of UGX 4,300,000, which they will divide among themselves.  They have a challenge of low productivity, and they thought of having a loan to buy mulch and pay school fees for their children. 

Mulch will improve the productivity of their agricultural products. Their prime target is to change the lives of their families and also to take their children to better schools in the country. 

Milia will use the loan to buy mulch for her banana plantation. Her challenge has been a lack of resources, but with the loan her productivity will increase and so will her status in society, which will help her achieve her dreams.

In the photograph are the group members and the Ugafode credit officer (extreme left)

loans.use: To buy mulch for her banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy building materials such as zinc sheeting, beams, cement, sand, gravel and hire laborers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 34-years-old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the region of Kampala West in Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom currently attend school.  For the past four years, Paul has been working hard to manage his brick laying business, which makes bricks.  

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase bricks and labor, and will help Paul generate greater profits and provide for his family. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Paul, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase bricks and labor for his brick laying business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married and has two children, both adults.She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past10 years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is single, with no children . She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentions seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is 24 years old and lives in Margibi County, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia.  She lives with her boyfriend and 7-year- old child. 

For two years now she has been involved in the red oil business. She was taught how to sell by her aunty. For over eight years now she has been selling red oil in the local market. She makes more profit and gets popular every day. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more red oil for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Nurima

texts.en:
Nurima is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Her child is too young for receiving education. Nurima has received education until class VII (grade 7), and her husband has received education until class V (grade 5). For a long time, they have been struggling hard to bear all the household expenses of their family, but still they did not lose their hope.

Nurima is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer.  Both Nurima and her husband dream to give a good future to their children. But to provide a good future, money is required and for that, they decided to enhance their business. Hence, they planned to take a loan so that they can purchase potato seeds and can grow potatoes in their field. Then they can earn more money by selling potatoes. 

They are very courageous, and they think that one day they will have their own pakka house (house made of brick and cement) with the profit that they earn.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman.  She has eleven children, two of whom attend school and the rest are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kadzo prepares groundnuts and sells them to her neighbors and passers-by. The major challenge she faces is seasonality.

With the  20,000 Kenyan Shillings, Kadzo wants to purchase more sacks of groundnuts to resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of groundnuts to resale.

loans.name: Ligia Apolonia

texts.es:
Ligia es una señora, es madre soltera con hijo a su cargo a quien le brinda  todo su a poyo para su desarrollo y formación.
Ella es  de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 15 años de experiencia en el ramo.
Ligia se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar su sexto financiamiento ya que con ellos a ido construyendo y mejorando su vivienda. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir un  cuarto de habitación para tener mejores condiciones y privacidad en su vivienda. Dicho Financiamiento lo utilizara  para  la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: piedrín, arena, cemento, hierro y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Ligia is a woman and a single mother. She has a son under her care whom she provides with all support for his development and formation. 
She is a professional primary school teacher with 15 years of experience in the field. 
Ligia came to CEPRODEL for her sixth loan to request financing to build and improve her home. Currently, she has the need to build a bedroom for better living conditions and privacy in her home. She will use her loan to purchase construction materials such as gravel, sand, cement, iron, and bricks.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as gravel, sand, cement, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Damarys De Los Angeles

texts.es: Damarys es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora de 41 años, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, de 17 y 4 años, su negocio es la venta de zapatos, ropa, gaseosa, hielo, helados desde hace 6 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, shores, blusas, sandalias, bóxer, biquinis, brasieres, etc.
texts.en: Damarys, 41, is an enterprising and tenacious woman. She is married with two minor children aged 17 and 4 years. Her business is selling shoes, clothing, soft drinks, ice, and ice cream which she has done for 6 years. She has been a client of this institution for 6 years. The loan she requests is necessary for the purchase of merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, blouses, sandals, boxers, bikinis, bras, and others.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, and more.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 47 years old, and she lives in the town of Lugazi in Uganda. She is married, with two children, both in school. 

For the past 20 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her clothing & tailoring business, which deals in clothing. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy machines for more tailoring  work.  It will help Harriet to generate greater profits and live a good life. 

Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to Increase income levels. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy machines for more tailoring work

loans.name: Cenelia  Elizabeth

texts.es: Cenelia de profesión es maestra de primaria, tiene 18 años de laborar en dicha actividad, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por una hija y su esposo la que estudia en un colegio de la localidad y que tiene el deber de proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, esta señora tiene una urgencia de  mejorar el techo y embaldosar ,ya que el piso  es de tierra , por eso decidió visitar a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y  brindarles  mejores condiciones de vida  a su familia. Dicho financiamiento lo utilizaría para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como  zinc , cemento y pago de mano de obra
texts.en:
Cenelia is an elementary school teacher.  She has been working in said activity for 18 years.  Her family is comprised of a daughter, who goes to the local school, and her husband.  They have the responsibility of giving her the conditions needed for her development.

This lady urgently needs to improve the roof and to lay down tile because the floor is dirt.  That is why she decided to visit Cepradol to receive the benefit of a loan and to provide her family with better living conditions.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials like zinc sheeting and cement and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like zinc sheeting and cement and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the region of Fort Portal in Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which deals in different medicines. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy medicine for the shop and will help Robert to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his inventory further. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has ten children — nine in school and one still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling poultry. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With a loan of 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Hovakim

texts.en:
Hovakim is 42 years old and he lives in the village of Khachardzan in the Tavush region. Hovakim is trained as a teacher and for many years he has worked at their village school. Today, at the same school, he works as a deputy director. The entire school and village respect and like him very much. 

Hovakim is a good and wise person and also a very skilled farmer. Together with his wife, he takes care of their farm and they are also engaged in bee keeping. They have six cows, eight calves, ten sheep, ten piglets, twenty chickens and forty beehives. They sell a great range of farm products such as meat, dairy products, eggs, honey etc. Thanks to his hard work and savings of several years, Hovakim has bought some furniture for his house, a computer and car for his family. 

For Hovakim, as for any farmer, coming of winter brings a lot of problems and worries about how to provide the cattle with fodder and warmth. Therefore, Hovakim asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy a lot of fodder for his cattle and also to prepare his beehives for winter protecting them from the cold.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle and material to prepare his beehives for winter

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una joven de 27 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a su familia en el Caserío Chuacruz, Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella es una joven entusiasta que le gusta servir a su comunidad; actualmente ella es tutora de niños en la iglesia donde vive; cuenta que esta actividad le gusta mucho porque es bonito trabajar con niños; por otro lado esta actividad le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su familia y de ella. Vilma tiene dos años de estar dedicándose a esta labor. Además de esta actividad, es alfabetizadora en su comunidad.

Además de estas labores ella quiere salir adelante personalmente y para ello solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa.
Vilma sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para tener una vida más digna tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma, a 27-year-old single woman, lives with her family in Caserío Chuacruz, Nahualá, Sololá.

This enthusiastic young lady likes to serve the community.  Currently, she is a private tutor for children in the church in her village.  She tells us that she loves doing this because working with children is nice.  This work also provides her with the income necessary to cover her and her family's expenses.  Vilma has been doing this work now for two years.  Apart from this, she is also a literacy tutor in the community.

In addition to this work, she also would like to improve her personal life, which is why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Quetzales to buy building material to improve her house.  She dreams of making her living conditions better so that she can make a more dignified life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials to improve her house

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en: Vahagn is from the town of Yerevan, where he lives with his mother. For many years, Vahagn has been engaged in vehicle repair services. In a rented garage near one of the city markets, Vahagn provides different type of vehicle repair services. Due to his hard work, Vahagn manages to cover his family's needs. Now, as the worker of the family, Vahagn wants to enlarge his business activity. He needs financial support so he is able to purchase tools and materials and enlarge his business of providing vehicle repair services. Vahagn has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vahagn so he can meet his client's needs in more appropriate ways and be able to make a higher income to earn a living for himself and his mother.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials to provide vehicle repair services.

loans.name: Ishiatu

texts.en:
Ishiatu is 35 years old and married with two children. She runs a business selling domestic products in the Tombo Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business because she wants to improve conditions for her family.  

She has been in this business since after the war. She sells glasses, plates, knives, and food containers within her community. She says that the main challenge for her business is the business location.

Ishiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu is in her late forties and married, with three children between 3 years and 15 years. 

She runs a general merchandise business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She began her business to strive for her living

She’s been in this business after she got married.  She sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and soap within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is lack of capital to expand.

Mamusu has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and soap for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living.

In the future, she would like to open a big provisions shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 44-years-old and she lives in the airport community.  She completed 12th grade and she and her fiance are living together. For the past eight years she has been frying and selling doughnuts in the local market. She faces problems like the high price of flour since she has little income. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, etc. to expand her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred is 43 years old and married. She lives in the community surrounding the Airport of Margibi County (the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia) with her seven children, ages between 21 and 28. All of her children are living on their own, and one is attending grade school.

For the past four years, Winifred has been running a cook shop (restaurant). She uses the bus most of the time to get her supplies to her shop. She likes having customers and she enjoys how supportive her business is. She learned about business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients like oil, fish, etc. to stock her restaurant business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients like oil, fish, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband’s name is Wajid, and he is 30 years old. Among the children, only one of them receives education, while the other two are too young for receiving education. 

Hasina and her family live in a small town of Dhupguri. Hasina is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. They have taken this loan to enhance the business of farming, so that they can buy seeds and fertilizers for potato farming. Then they can harvest potatoes and sell them in the market.  According to them, selling potatoes is very profitable; for that reason, they thought to cultivate potatoes. 

Like every mother, Hasina also dreams to give a bright future to her children and also wants to support her family. They are thankful and grateful to BJS for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil is a 38-year-old married woman, and her husband is 42 years old. Emil is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. Her husband has received education up to class IX (grade 9). Emil and her husband have three children. All three children receive education. The family lives in a small town of Maynaguri. 

In her childhood, Emil trained in how to prepare incense. Using that skill now, Emil is preparing incense and supporting her family. 

Her husband is a mason and does not earn much for the family. Sometimes he doesn’t have any work, especially in the rainy season. For the time being, he has to sit idle. At that time, no income is generated by her husband. She wanted to help her husband in maintaining a good livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (sticks, perfume, etc.) for making incense.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add charcoal stock and to improve the restaurant business.

loans.name: Moises Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias luchadoras y trabajadoras una de ellas se llama María Teresa mujer de 37 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de comida y accesorios de cyber papelería, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad económica 5 años, es cliente de la institución desde hace 1 año, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus cuotas. Solicita un crédito nuevamente para la compra de mercadería de ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, shores, calculadoras, folders, lapiceros, etc. Dora tiene la edad de 50 años, su negocio es un taller de costura y Gabriela tiene  27 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The Moises group is made up of three hard-working members who are described as fighters. One of them is Maria Teresa, who is 37 years old and married. Her business is selling food, stationery and small computer accessories. She has been working at her business for five years. 

Maria Teresa has been a client of the field partner for one year, and she is described as a person who has shown herself to be responsible with her loan payments. The group is requesting a new loan to buy clothing and other merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, calculators, folders and pencils.

Dora is 50 years old and her business is a dressmaking shop. Gabriela is 27 years old and has a business selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, calculators, folders and pencils.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as optimistic and determined. Teresia operates a retail shop where she sells household items and cereals. She also does farming. 

Teresia describes her family's challenge to be the lack of a water storage facility during the rainy season. She will use the 21,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan to purchase a water tank. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be trustworthy and ever happy. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. She also owns rental houses. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation in prices of products she sells. 

She will use the KES 15,600 loan to purchase a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a tank to store clean water at home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, Esther has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items for her kiosk/shop.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Juliet has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. 

Jeniffer describes her biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects farming and prices of commodities. She will use the KES 41,500 loan to purchase a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to do dairy farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with two children who both go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mariam cooks fried potatoes and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Manashi

texts.en:
Manashi is a 38-year-old married woman. She is mother of a single child. The child is too young for receiving education. Her husband is 45 years old and he is involved in a job as a caretaker in a private farm. 

Manashi always tries to give financial support to her husband and family.For that reason she started her saree (a kind of Indian dress) business. She sells sarees door-to-door. But due to lack of capital she could not buy many varieties of sarees and hence her sales were also not satisfactory. Thus she thought to expand her business by buying a lot of varieties of sarees so that she can expand her business. For that reason she has applied for a loan of INR 8000 to BJS. She dreams that her business will flourish and she will be able to open her own saree shop.  She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase sarees (a kind of Indian dress) for selling.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is 53 years old. She is married to Falen who is 55 years old. They have three children .One is in class VII (grade 8) and the other two work in a puffed rice mill. 

Radhika is a housewife while her husband is a farmer. As a farmer his income is very low, because he could not buy different   varieties of vegetables. Therefore, Radhika thought to help her husband in his business so that their family can run smoothly.  For that reason she has taken loan of INR 13,000 from BJS to help her husband so that he can expand his business by buying potato seeds and fertilizers and sell those potatoes in the market. According to them selling potatoes is very profitable. They hope that they will also have a good future by selling potatoes and with the profit that they earn.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for potato farming

loans.name: Salema

texts.en:
Salema is aged 51 and a hardworking lady from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri District. She lives with her husband and three children, two daughters and one son. Her daughters are pursuing their studies; one is in B.A. (Bachelors of Arts) and M.A. (Masters of Arts). Salema’s son is a farmer, associated with tea leaf farming. 

Salema decided to grow tea in her own land to maintain a good livelihood and to give financial support to her family. There the land and weather is very much favorable for tea cultivation. Her son also has knowledge of farming tea. So Salema decided to cultivate tea in that land. There is a great demand for tea in that area. She wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future with the profit from her business she dreams of building a sanitary toilet.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow tea in her own land.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 34 years old and lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is married and has 5 children between 8 months and 17 years old. Among her children only three are in school and they all live at home. 

Over the past 8 years she has been involved with the sale of food in the local market. She was helped by her aunty to start her business; where she gets some money from. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, salt, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate all of her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fruit drinks, cookies, and sweets, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Shantal Kaitesi

texts.en:
Shantali is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the  region of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Shantali has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, selling charcoal to the community. To help expand her business, Shantali has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used as added capital to the business, and will help Shantali to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Shantali hopes that, in the future, she will be able to increase the inventory. 

Shantali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Shantali, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add capital to her charcoal business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing stock of Milo (beverage powder), detergents, spices, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the  region of Mukono in Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Janet has been working hard to manage her charcoal business where she sells firewood and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood and charcoal to stock, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and Improve standards of living. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful entrepreneur. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Janet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair extensions, hair pomade, and hair relaxers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries to meet the customers' demands.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a  Kiva borrower. She believes in change and hopes that her dreams will be fulfilled. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes and repairs clothes. 

Josphine describes her family's challenges to be water storage and water harvesting. She will use the KES 6,430 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a  Kiva borrower. She believes that her dreams will be fulfilled. She operates a charcoal selling business. 

Mary describes her family's challenge to be the lack of a water storage facility. She will use the KES 6,430 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be future oriented and positive. She operates a grocery shop where she sells bananas,coconuts and other items. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of a water storage facility. She will use the KES 6,430 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as futuristic. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. 

She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to purchase a water tank to store clean water for domestic use during the dry season. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable, united family. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: purchase a water tank

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 36 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling beans and sorghum for the past two years. With this loan, she will reinvest in her business adding more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be added to savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a Kiva borrower. She believes that loans will change her life. She operates a retail shop where she sells washing soap, sugar, spices and other items. 

Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a water storage facility. She will use the KES 6,430 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 35 years old. She sells beans and sorghum. She has been in the business for the past 12 years. 

With this loan, Alphonsine would like to buy more beans to sell. She plans to use the profits towards making more investments for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Velerie

texts.en:
Velerie is 60 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 13. 

With the loan, Velerie would like to buy more bananas for making local beers, which she been selling for the past five years. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more local beer to sell.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Deliphine is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. 

With this loan, Deliphine would like to buy more charcoal to sell. She has recently moved from selling foodstuffs, such as sorghum and beans, to selling charcoal for which she has a feeling of earning more returns. The profits from the business will be used to buy cows for providing milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dorothee

texts.en: Dorothee is 32 years old. She sells foods items and has spent five years in the business. With this loan, she would like to buy more corn and sorghum to sell. She is planning to make more savings from the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more corn and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a widowed woman with seven children; four in school and three adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jumwa has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria es una joven señora de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos; vive junto a su familia en el Caserío Central, El Tablón, departamento de Sololá.
Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a elaborar artículos de metal (puertas, ventanas, balcones, entre otros), ella cuenta que la misma necesidad ha hecho que ellos se dediquen a esta actividad, debido a la poca oportunidad de trabajo que existe en su comunidad; también expresa que este tipo de labores la realizan pocas personas y por ello es bien pagado. Ella se siente muy contenta de apoyar a su esposo para salir adelante y generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de ellos y de sus dos preciosos hijos.
Llevan 4 años realizando esta labor; además de esta actividad ella se dedica también a los oficios domésticos, y al cuidado de sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de herramientas para la elaboración de artículos de metal.
Maria sueña con apoyar a sus hijos a ser profesionales e instalar otro negocio que le genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 24, is a young married woman.  She has two children and lives with her family in the hamlet of Central, El Tablón, in the department of Sololá.

She and her husband earn a living making doors, windows, window grilles, and other articles of metal.  She says they do this work because there are few job opportunities in the community.  She also says that few people do this type of work and that it's well paid.

María's very happy to help her husband get ahead and generate enough income to cover their needs and those of their two beautiful children.  They have been doing this work for four years.  In addition to this job María also does the household chores and takes care of the children.

María's requesting a loan for 5,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy tools to make articles of metal.

She dreams of helping her children become professionals and starting another business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop  business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es separada,  tiene tres hijos. Su hija mayor se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomia y sus hijos menores aun estan en el colegio, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Urbanizacion Mariscal Santa Cruz de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella solo curso el nivel primario por la falta de dinero de sus padres ,actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama. Ella tiene su puesto de venta propia, donde vende de martes a domingo.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir material de construccion (cemento, arena, ladrillos, estuco, etc.);  asi podra realizar una habitacion para brindar a asus hijos mayor comodidad, pues ellos vivian en la casa de un familiar como cuidadores.
El sueño de  Rosa es tener una casa con departamentos para cada uno de susu hijos.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Rosa is separated.  She has three children.  Her oldest daughter is studying Gastronomy.  Her minor children are still in school.  They live in their own house in the Mariscal Santa Cruz neighborhood in the city of El Alto.  She only went to primary school due to her parents’ lack of money.  She currently sells women’s underwear.  She has her own sales stand where she sells Tuesdays through Sundays.

She needs the loan to get construction material (cement, sand, bricks, and stucco, etc).  This way she will be able to build a room in order to make her children more comfortable.  They lived in a relative’s house as caregivers.

Rosa’s dream is to have a house with areas for each of her children.

This is the third time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to get construction material (cement, sand, bricks, and stucco, etc).

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de fabricacion y venta de colchones,el socio vende en diferentes lugares,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de colchones.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales para hacer colchones como espuma y telas.

El socio Gerardo está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gerardo continues making a living by making and selling mattresses. He sells in various places. He works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. Gerardo has had this business for many years, and it is going very well. His dream is to expand his business selling mattresses. He is asking for the loan to buy materials to make mattresses, such as foam and fabrics.

Gerardo is happy about the loan and commits to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy materials to make mattresses, such as foam and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of flour, sugar, tinned foods etc. which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby products to increase her sales abilities.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be future-oriented and positive. She sells charcoal to earn a living. 

Tatu describes her family's challenge to be water storage. She will use the KES 6,430 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her standards of living. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Judithe

texts.en:
Judithe is 39 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of one and fifteen years old. Five of them attend school. 

She sells meat and has been dealing in this business for the past year. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat for sale in the butcher shop. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Yassa

texts.en:
Yassa is 34 years old. She stopped her education at grade 6. She is married and has two children; age one month old and 17. Only one of her children is in school. Her husband works in a factory. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is a fish producing area on the Liberian local market.  

She has been selling cosmetics in the local market and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a 25,000 LRD loan to buy more cosmetics to for her business. She likes her business because it is her major source of money. She hopes to have a new home.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old. She lives in airport community and she is married. Her three children, between the ages of 15 and 22 years old, are in school.  

For ten years now, Victoria has been selling red oil. She started her business with two thousand Liberian Dollars ($ 2,000 RLD), and she learned the business from her mother. One thing that makes her proud about her business is that every day she makes some profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees for her nursing studies.

loans.name: Nesthor Paul

texts.es:
Nesthor Paul es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Nesthor, tengo 21 años y actualmente resido en La Vega, Rep. Dom., soy soltero, sin hijos y tengo 2 hermanos, mis padres son de escasos recursos y se dedican a los quehaceres domésticos.
Soy estudiante de medicina en la UCATESI, decidí estudiar esta carrera porque me apasiona y porque quiero ayudar a otras personas de escasos recursos a tener mejores atenciones médicas, las materias que más me apasionan son: Anatomía, Fisiología e Histología.
Decidí recurrir al préstamo de KIVA-FUNDAPEC ya que no tengo recursos necesarios para poder cubrir los gastos y mis padres no pueden costeármelos, de no obtener este préstamo no podría seguir estudiando ya que no tengo un trabajo y  con lo que ganan mis padres a penas nos da para sobrevivir.
Mi meta es formarme como médico aprovechando al máximo el proceso de aprendizaje y luego poder optar por hacer mi maestría y poder servirle a mi comunidad.
texts.en:
Nesthor Paul is a young medical student. He is applying for a loan to be able to pay his educational expenses. This is his story: 

My name is Nesthor. I am 21  years old and I now live in La Vega, Dominican Republic. I am single, without children, and I have two siblings. My parents are of scarce resources, and they work at domestic duties.

I am a medical student at UCATESI. I decided to study for this career because I love it and because I want to help other people of scarce resources to have better medical attention. The subjects that I am most passionate about are anatomy, physiology, and histology. 

I decided to turn to a loan from Kiva-FUNDAPEC since I don't have the necessary resources to be able to cover the expenses, and my parents can't bear the costs. If I don't obtain this loan, I will not be able to continue studying, since I don't have a job, and what my parents earn barely gives us enough to survive.

My goal is to train as a doctor, taking maximum advantage of the learning process and then being able to choose to do my master's degree and be able to serve my community.

loans.use: to cover the fees for his studies in medicine

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 28 year old married man. He has 2 children, aged 6 months and 5 years. 

Johnson operates a farm where he grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water for irrigation. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for irrigation. His business goal is to have multiple businesses within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Livio Raul

texts.es:
Livio Raul es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Civil, él está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Livio Raúl tengo 19 años, soy de Santo Domingo, República Dominicana, tengo dos hermanos, mi hermana mayo de 20 años y un hermanito menor de 8 años, vivo con mi madre en casa de mis abuelos y mi madre.
Comencé el primer trimestre de la carrera de ingeniería civil en INTEC, ya que deseo desarrollarme porque me gusta mucho y considero que es una de la más importante, también y quiero en el futuro poder ayudar a mi familia y aquellas personas que realmente la necesitan, pero debido a que la situación económica me ha mermado los ingresos de mi madre, si no obtengo una ayuda para poder pagar la universidad, me veré en la necesidad de retirarme.
Mi necesidad y deseo es poder contar alguien que me pueda brindar la mano amiga y poder cumplir mi sueño de terminar mi carrera sin ningún desplome, ya que después de terminar mi carrera seguiré especializándome y de esa forma ayudaría a mi comunidad que tanto lo necesita, diseñando métodos de trabajo y enseñándole a mis compañeros del sector que con esfuerzo se puede lograr la meta.
En caso de no ser favorecido, me vería muy forzado a cumplir mi meta y terminar mis estudios fuera de tiempo,  estudiando en este país podemos lograr seguir avanzando y modernizando a la altura de los países desarrollados.
Muchas gracias.
texts.en:
Livio Raul is a young civil engineering student. He is requesting a loan so that he can pay for his studies, and this is his story:

"My name is Livio Raúl. I'm 19 years old and I am from Santo Domingo, in the Dominican Republic. I have two siblings - my 20-year-old older sister, and a little 8-year-old brother. I live with my mother in my grandparent's and mother's home.

I started the first trimester of my civil engineering degree at INTEC. I want to take this degree because I like it a lot and also because I think it's one of the most important degrees. In the future, I want to be able to help my family and people who really need it, but given the economic situation my mother's earnings have diminished. If I don't get some help to be able to pay for university, I will need to withdraw.

What I need and desire is that someone is able to offer me a friendly hand, and that I can achieve my dream of finishing my degree without withdrawing. After I finish my degree, I will continue to specialize. In this way I will help my community with its needs, designing work methods and teaching my industry peers that, with effort, we can meet our goals.

If I do not get this loan, I will be forced to achieve my goal and finish my studies off-schedule. In this country, by studying, we can keep advancing and modernizing up to the level of developed countries.

Thank you very much."

loans.use: to pay for his civil engineering studies.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a Kiva borrower. She believes that loans will change her life. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be getting firewood for cooking. She will use the KES 2,796 loan to buy an energy saving cooking jiko (charcoal stove) for use in her restaurant. She hopes that in the future she can buy a water tank. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy an energy saving cooking jiko

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials,  indirectly helping him to boost his overall sales.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es productora de leche,la cual vende a una de las empresas recolectoras de leche de La Paz.
