Doña Domitila está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, huevos, café, pan, manteca, etc. para poder surtir y tener bien abastecido para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que con esta inversión mejore un poco su calidad de vida y pueda seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña Elsi se dedica al comercio su negocio en la venta de de abarrotería desde hace 3 años.
Doña Blanca tiene un pulpería en su casa de habitación y también se dedica a la venta de verduras en general.
Doña Diana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y venta  de productos por catalogo.

Danlí, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Domitila is an enterprising woman who is loved in her community.  She is a merchant and her main source of income is selling groceries and has been doing this for 15 years.  She runs her business out of her home and her main customers are the residents of her community and employees from a melon company.

Domitila only has a small inventory because the melon planting season has not started and her sales are a bit low, but since the season is about to begin, she is asking for a new loan because the previous one was of great help.

Domitila is asking for a loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, lard, etc. so she can stock up and have a good assortment so she can serve her customers.  She expects that this investment will help her improve her quality of life a bit, so she can continue to support her family.

Elsi has been selling groceries for three years.  Blanca has a general store in her home and also sells vegetables.  Diana sells cosmetics and other items via catalog.

Danlí, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Pushpa

texts.en:
Puspa, 43 years old, is a housewife in the small village of Maynaguri and has received a primary education. Her husband, Subhas, is 50 years old and has his B.A. (Bachelor in Arts). He has a signboard business. They have two sons who are helping their father in his business. 

In their locality, there is a good demand for their business. But due to the lack of capital, they cannot expand their business. Pushpa wants to help her husband’s business by taking a loan from BJS. This loan will be used for purchasing raw materials for expanding their business so that they can earn more profit. 

She gives hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To buy paint and other supplies for a signboard business.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita and her husband Bapi live in the small town of Maynaguri in Dhupguri. They have two children.  One is studying in class III (grade 3) and the other one is studying in class VI (grade 6). Her husband runs a saree business and she is also associated with it. They sell sarees door to door. They do not have enough income from their business to run their family because they do not have sufficient stock. To build good stock, she decided to take a loan from BJS so that their sales increase. They are experienced in the saree business and this business is in demand in her locality. She wants to give a higher education to her children after earning a good profit from this business. 

Her dream is to open a saree shop with the profit. She is very happy to become a member of BJS and thankful to Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase sarees (an Indian dress) to sell

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem is 42 years old and married. She is blessed with three children and currently resides in Kampong Speu province. She grows rice as the main source of income. This business earns her about USD $9 per day. Khem has had previous loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to provide sufficient food for her children and created stable living conditions in a good place. For this loan, she is borrowing money to cover the school fee for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates..

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her son

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati, 47, is a hardworking housewife from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri District. She is illiterate, but just knows how to sign her name. She lives with her husband and two children. One of them is in class XI (grade 11), and the other one is working as a mason.

Malati’s husband is involved in a builder's business and Malati assists her husband in his business. The demand of building materials is high in their locality. Because they have an insufficient amount of stock to sell, their earnings are not enough to cover the family's expenses. To increase the stock, she needs a loan.  After getting the loan, she wants to purchase bricks for their business. 

Her future dream is to develop this trade on a large scale so they can earn much profit and cover the family expenses smoothly. Both of them are thankful to BJS and KIVA for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase bricks for their builders shop

loans.name: Manoka

texts.en:
Manoka, 24, is a housewife and lives in the small village of Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri District with her husband, Jiten, 30 years old, and their two children (one son and one daughter).  Manoka had studied up to class IV (grade 4) and her husband is illiterate but can sign his name. The children are pursuing their studies. Her son is in class VI (grade 6) and her daughter is in class VII (grade 7). They want to give them a higher education and to see them in a good position in society.

Her husband is a tea grower who farms tea on their land. But due to lack of capital, they are not farming well. So Manoka wants a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers to grow tea on a large scale. The demand for green tea leaves is more in that area because there are a lot of tea gardens. They hope this farming will give them more earnings. 

In the future, they want to build a sanitary toilet with the profit. She gives hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers to grow tea on her own land.

loans.name: Rup Laxmi

texts.en:
Rup Laxmi is 43 years old. She is married and has one child who is 25 years old.  Many years ago, she established her tailoring business.  Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Rupa Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo2, the eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. She began her business because she wants to improve her family. In 2001, Mariatu established her general stock business. She works at the business nine hours a day, seven days a week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.
Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mariatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is 44 years old and blessed with three children. To support her family, she farms rice as the primary source of income. Her husband works for others as a driver. She has previously borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to keep her children in school and support her agribusiness. She has applied for a new loan to support her son’s education fees. She hopes that she can fulfill her son's dream for a bachelor's degree in economics and to get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To support her son’s education costs

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Norn  is 42 and a resident from Kampong Speu province, Norn is married and blessed with five children. Nowadays, she needs to support only one child who is studying at a local university. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises cows. This business has returned her about USD $6.25 per day. She is a previous client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her past loan which she has repaid back with success to improve her living conditions and keep her kids in school. However, paying the school fee at university for her son is quite the challenge for her. Therefore, she decided to take out an education loan to cover the tuition for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in English literature. She hopes that her son can get a decent job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the tuition for her son

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 57-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He practices agriculture but is also involved in the transport business in order to raise money to support his family. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect his business growth. He has a desire to venture into modern farming by seeking advice from the national advisory services platform which trains farmers in the best farming practices. As a good father, he desires to educate his children up to university and set up other income-generating activities. Fred is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ramona es originaria de la ciudad Boaco, casada y madre de tres hijos. De 46 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de  pulpería. Inicio en este negocio desde hace 10 años, vendiendo todo tipo de productos. Poco a poco fue ofreciendo una variedad más amplia de mercadería como la venta de ropa y zapatos. Hoy en día tiene un negocio próspero y diversidad de productos. Su meta próximo es comprar un poco más de mercadería y mantener un surtido en su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: zapatos, lencería, cosméticos, productos básicos como el arroz y jabón entre otros, con el fin de diversificar su pulpería. Estima que el crédito le ayudará a obtener mejores ganancias y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mantener un alto nivel de ventas y seguir mejorando el negocio.
texts.en: Ramona is a native of the city of Boaco. She is married and the mother of three children. She is forty-six years old. A retailer by profession, she runs a small general store. She began this business ten years ago, selling all types of products. Little by little, she began offering a greater variety of merchandise, such as clothing and shoes. Currently, she has a prosperous business and an assortment of products. Her next goal is to buy a little more merchandise and to maintain an assortment of products in her business. She is applying for this loan to buy shoes, lingerie, cosmetics, and commodities, such as rice and soap, among others, in order to diversify her general store. She estimates that the loan will help her to increase her earnings and meet customer demand. Her future plan is to maintain a high level of sales and continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, lingerie, cosmetics, and commodities, such as rice and soap, among others.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a stationary shop, and he started the business in order to supplement his monthly salary as a civil servant. A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to university and set up other income-generating activities. Customers not paying on time and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to set up another stationary shop in a nearby town. Solomon is requesting a loan to buy stationary items such as books and box files to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationary items such as books and box files to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells cosmetics and she started the business after realizing that the meager salary that she earns as a teacher can hardly meet her family's needs. Inadequate capital and the high cost of rent are her major challenges, while her dream is to trade in wholesale. Janet intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a forty-year-old married woman with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Twenty years ago she decided to venture into the clothing business and she mainly trades in African attire, which attracts a lot of demand from tourists. She also operates a mobile money business where she facilitates transfer of money using the phone and earns a commission. Inadequate capital and the high cost of rent affect her business growth while her dreams are to educate her children up to the University and trade in wholesale. Winnie intends to use the loan to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 30-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has four children, but only two go to school. She is a farmer who grows mainly cocoa and also deals in agricultural produce in order to raise money to support her family. Like most farmers she is challenged by the seasonal nature of the crops and inadequate capital to meet the high demand for food in the area. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees up to the University. Annet intends to use the loan to buy cocoa and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and rice to sell.

loans.name: Yosofu

texts.en: Yosofu is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business for three years. He started the business after realizing that farming is seasonal and thus cannot be depended on to meet his family's daily expenses. Like all good and responsible fathers, his desire is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect his business growth while his plans are to venture into mechanized agriculture and trade in wholesale. Yosofu intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: La Confianza Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman cinco integrantes trabajadores y luchadores uno de ellos es Mercedes tiene la edad de 53 años, soltero, su negocio es la venta de tamales pisques en el mercado de Granada. Tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad 20 años, el crédito lo está requiriendo para la compra de materia prima como quintal de maíz, leña, cal, hojas. Concepción tiene la edad de 46 años su negocio es la venta de flores,Dora mujer de 26 años su negocio es una pulpería, Esperanza mujer de 51 años se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de mango y mamon, Margarita tiene la edad de 49 años su negocio es la venta de tamales pisques.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 5 hard-working and determined members. One of them is Mercedes, a 53-year-old single man. His business is selling  "tamales pisques" [tamales made with bean filling] in the market in Granada and he has been doing this for 20 years.

Mercedes needs the loan to buy raw materials such as a quintal of corn, firewood, lime powder and leaves.

Concepción is 46 and sells flowers; Dora is 26 and she runs a small grocery shop; Esperanza is 51 and she buys and sells mango and papaya crops; Margarita is 49 years old and has a business selling tamales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as a quintal of corn, firewood, lime powder and leaves.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 61 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos que hoy son mayores de 28 años. Su experiencia de negocio en el área de las confecciones, data desde hace 13 años, cuando por necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia surgió la idea de confeccionar ropa, comprando una máquina sencilla, poco a poco estructuró una clientela y a este negocio adicionó otra actividad productiva, que le generara liquidez, como la venta de bollos, o amasijos de maíz, mezclado con queso, envueltos en hojas del mismo árbol, para lo cual compró un molino y empezó su producción. Ella aun cuenta con los dos ingresos y sus clientelas la conforman los vecinos de su sector quienes compran la ropa que ella elabora y tiendas del barrio que venden sus amasijos de maíz. Carmen trabaja desde los lunes hasta los domingos sin parar y en sus negocios realiza  ella sola, todas las tareas de sus procesos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  maíz, queso, sal, pitas  en un mayor volumen y por otro lado telas e hilos, para hacer de su credikiva la mejor inversión posible, en la temporada de diciembre donde sus ventas de ambos negocios tocan picos altos y ella quiere estar muy preparada para ganar un poco más.
texts.en: Carmen, who's sixty-one years old, is the mother of four children, who are now all older than twenty-eight years old. Her business experience in the area of clothing dates back to thirteen years ago when, due to the necessity of getting her family ahead, the idea of making clothing dawned to her. Buying a simple machine, she gradually built a customer base, and in addition to this activity, she added another productive business that provided her with an income. That business was the selling of "bollos," or steamed corn buns, mixed with cheese and wrapped in corn husks, for which she bought a grinder and began her production. She still has these two incomes and her customer base is made up of her neighbors who buy her clothing and neighborhood stores that sell her corn buns. Carmen works from Monday to Sunday without a break, and she alone performs all of the work. Currently, she is applying for a loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy corn, cheese, salt, and pitas in bulk; she will also buy fabric and thread. She is applying for this loan to make the best investment possible during the December season when her sales from both businesses hit a high point and she wants to be very prepared in order to earn a little more.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread, as well as cheese, salt, and pitas in bulk.

loans.name: Valle Verde Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por seis integrantes uno de ellos es Ada tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es un cafetín ubicado en su domicilio además de esto vende comida, tiene de dedicarse a esto 8 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como gaseosas, jugos, galletas, marucha, café, frescos, arroz, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, repollo, carbón, plátanos, queso, etc. María mujer de 34 años su negocio es una pulpería, Juana mujer de 37 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, calzado, frijoles cocidos, otros, Elba tiene la edad de 58 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y bisutería, Humberto tiene la edad de 31 años su negocio es la venta de comida y Lucia mujer de 27 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, calzado, cocteles, frito.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 6 members. One of them is Ada who is 57 years old and has one child under her responsibility. She runs a small cafe in her home and also sells food. She has been doing this for 8 years.

Ada is asking for the loan to buy supplies such as  fizzy drinks, juice, biscuits, Marucha soup, coffee, soft drinks, rice, oil, beef, chicken, pork, cabbage, charcoal, bananas, cheese etc. 

María is 34 years old and runs a small grocery store; Juana is 37 years old and sells clothing, footwear, cooked beans and other items; 58-year-old Elba sells clothing, cosmetics and jewellery; Humberto is 31 and sells food and Lucia who is 27 sells cosmetics, footwear, cocktails and fried food.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fizzy drinks, juice, biscuits, Marucha soup, coffee, soft drinks, rice, oil, beef, chicken, pork, cabbage, charcoal, bananas, cheese etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de 15, 12  y 7 años de edad, las mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña María realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual tiene un tanquero  con  el cual surte de agua a ciertas empresas y fabricas en la ciudad de Manta, el  realiza varios viajes por día ya que es estos lugares requieren mucho de este liquido vital para poder trabajar, el recibe el pago semanal por la venta del agua, por lo cual requiere de capital para seguir trabajando, lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta labor la cual les ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y  combustibles para seguir trabajando. Lleva más de 3 años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y  le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of communal bank “Mujeres por el Progreso” [Women for Progress] meet in the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, famous for its varied traditional products, such as the toquilla straw hat [a.k.a. Panama hat], which is well-known locally and abroad.

This is where María lives. She is 33 years old, married and has three daughters aged 15, 12 and 7. The oldest ones go to upper school, the youngest to primary school. Her husband works as a driver.

María is requesting a loan to help her husband, who owns a tank truck. He supplies different companies and industrial facilities in the city of Manta with water. He makes different trips every day, considering that this precious liquid is vital in order to be able to work. He gets paid weekly, and needs some capital in order to continue with his business. He has been doing this for more than fifteen years, which has helped him to get ahead with his family.

With this loan, they will buy water and fuel. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than three years. She is in charge of collecting loan payments from the group and enjoys this activity, since she finds these loans very useful. Her dreams are to continue progressing and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy water and fuel.

loans.name: Las Sonrientes Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias de éxitos una de ellas es Xiomara tiene la edad de 41 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon, Zermat, y Vogue en su comunidad, y sus alrededores, también los comercializa en la zona franca, tiene de dedicarse a esto 17 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cosméticos, como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, shores, faldas, vestidos y electrodomésticos por encargo como plancha de cabello. Nohelia  tiene 22 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y chinelas, Raquel tiene la edad de 33 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon y Zermat.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 3 successful members. One of them is Xiomara who is 41 years old and married, with 2 children under her responsibility. Her business is selling Avon, Zermat and Vogue cosmetics in her community and the surrounding area. She also sells them in the free trade zone. She has been doing this for 17 years.

Xiomara is asking for the loan to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, creams and make-up, and clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses and domestic appliances to order, such as hair straighteners. 

Nohelia is 22 years old and sells clothing and flip-flops; Raquel is 33 and sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, make-up, clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses and domestic appliances to order such as hair straighteners.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: Jose Daniel nacio y ha vivido toda su vida en la comunidad de las nubes el comenta que solo logro estudiar primer grado de primaria ya que en esos tiempos no habían escuelas cercanas  en la comunidad. Así que se dedico a trabajar con su padre en los labores del campo años después el se caso y procreo su propia familia de esta tiene 9 hijos de los cuales  tres de ellos ya trabajan y apoyan con los gastos del hogar ademas de trabajar con el en las fincas cafetaleras de la zona. ellos en su casa no tienen energía eléctrica pues en su comunidad aun no llega la energía convencional por lo que diario gastan en estar comprando candelas o gas para el candil para poder alumbrarse por las noches.  Es por eso que el necesita hacer este tramite para poder acceder a tener un pequeño sistema solar para su vivienda y a si su familiar mejorar la condición de vida ademas de poder realizar otras actividades por las noches con su familia.
texts.en: Jose Daniel was born in, and has lived his entire life in, the community of Las Nubes. He says that he only managed to attend the first grade of elementary school because there were no nearby schools in the community during those times. Therefore, he began working in the fields with his father. Years later, he got married and started his own family. He has nine children, three of whom are now working and helping to cover home expenses in addition to working with him in the coffee plantations of the area. They have no electricity in their home since conventional energy still has not reached their community; for this reason, they spend money buying candles or gas for their oil lamp to light up their home at night on a daily basis. This is why he needs to perform this procedure in order to be granted a small home solar system for his home and his family, thus improving their quality of life in addition to giving them the ability to do other activities at night.

loans.use: to buy a small home solar system.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DANAYA est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  boissons sucrées à l’image de AMINA qui est la 1ére femme debout    dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 46 casiers de boissons sucrées avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 married women who have an average age of 42 and, on average, 4 children. They live in traditional, extended families in the district of Heremakono Nord, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships and friendships. They decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity and better do business, and are on their 3rd group loan. The 2 previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Amina, standing on the far right in the picture, is the group member who sells sugary drinks. She plans to use her loan to buy 46 cases of sugary drinks from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales for cash or credit, at the market and at home, to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugary drinks.

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLIMANI”  iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de víveres, venta de juguetes, artesanía en cotillón, venta de sujetadores de cabello, costura de edredones, venta de pollos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de sujetadores de cabello; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás al observar que estos productos eran altamente comercializados en el mercado, es por ello que ya trabaja con los mismos productos hace treinta años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sujetadores para cabello) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse en lo posible ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "ILLIMANI" communal bank will be starting its twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada centre. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Cristina is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling groceries, selling toys, making party supplies, selling hair clips, sewing quilts, selling chickens. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Cristina is an example. She says she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she runs a business selling hair clips. She says she started this business several years ago after noticing that a lot of this type of product is sold in the market. For this reason she has been working with the same products for 30 years.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase capital to buy hair clips which she will buy from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and will then sell in her business. This kind of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household, since she is a widow and has 2 children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training in loans and health.

loans.use: to buy hair clips.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es: María de 20 años de edad reside en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 2 años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de ropa (faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior, etc.), es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia. Desde que su hijo nació tiene la idea de construir un cuarto y así dar a su hijo mayor seguridad y comodidad. Esta es la razón por la que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maria is 20 years old and lives in her own home, along with her family, which includes her life’s partner and two year old son.  She has been selling clothing (skirts, dresses, blouses, undergarments, etc.) for the past 20 years.  She is a hardworking woman who is very dedicated to her family and has wanted to build another room since her son was born, so that she can provide him with more comfort and security.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, so she can buy galvanized metal and lumber to start building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rina Elizabeth

texts.es: Rina de 33 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 3 años de edad. Rina se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 5 años. Junto a su esposo mantiene la economía del hogar y dan a sus hijos las condiciones para un mejor desarrollo, pero sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea mejorarlas. Desea construir un muro de retención ya que cuando llueve el agua se desborda y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, grava y arena. Confía que con sus ingresos y los de su esposo tendrá la capacidad de pagar las cuotas del crédito que solicita.
texts.en: Rina is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 13 and 3.  She has been working as a housekeeper for the past five years and she and her husband support the home together, and provide their children with conditions for their development.  Their living conditions are very humble and she wants to improve them by building a retention wall, because the water enters the house whenever it rains and it damages their few possessions.  She is asking for a loan, though, FUSAI, so she can buy bricks, cement, gravel, and sand.  She is confident that her and her husband’s incomes will give them the ability to repay the loan she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA   est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  bois de chauffe à l’image de SITAN qui est la 1ére femme  débout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 chargements de charrette avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 married women who have an average age of 34 and, on average, 3 children. They live in traditional, extended families in the Dialanikoro district of  Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships and friendships. They decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity and better do business, and are on their 4th loan. The 3 previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Sitan, standing on the left in the picture, is the group member who sells firewood. She plans to use her loan to buy 12 cartloads of firewood from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales for cash or credit, at the market and at home, to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 53 años de edad reside en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar. Él trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a su carisma y calidad del trabajo que realiza ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes quienes cada día lo prefieren más. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, grava y arena para encementar el piso de su casa el cual en la actualidad es de tierra. Espera contar con este apoyo y así comenzar la mejora del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: Santos is 53 years old and lives with his family group under vary humble conditions.  He has worked as a mason for a long time.  Thanks to his charisma and the quality of his work, he has managed to win the trust of many customers who prefer him more and more.  He wants to make improvements to his home, so he is asking for this loan through FUSAI so that he can buy cement, gravel, and sand so that he can install a cement floor in his house, to replace the dirt floor he currently has. He is hoping for this loan so that he can begin improving his floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 54 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su querido esposo. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y junto a su esposo van saliendo adelante y mejorándolas poco a poco. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y Tamales de Elote. De esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Con la visión de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para lo cual necesita comprar lámina galvanizada y madera. Tiene plena confianza que con lo que percibe de su negocio logrará cancelar la deuda del crédito.
texts.en: Adela is 54 years old and lives with her husband in their own humble home.  They are getting ahead by making improvements little by little and she has been selling snacks and corn tamales for the past 10 years.  She earns a living this way and helps with the household finances.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, so that she can buy galvanized metal and lumber to build a room and improve her quality of life.  She is confident that she will be able to repay this debt with the money she earns in her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Silvia Jeannette

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 2 años 7 años y 9 años de edad. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar ya que para ellos sus hijos son lo más importante y es por ellos que luchan y se esfuerzan por dar mejores condiciones de vida.  Silvia se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y a la compra y venta de leña ya que en su localidad hay muchas personas que no tienen la capacidad para comprar una cocina de gas por lo que cocinan con leña. Desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha tomado la decisión de instalar la energía eléctrica. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  la instalación del servicio de energía y así poder dar a sus hijos de mejores condiciones de desarrollo.
texts.en: Silvia is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children, ages 2, 7, and 9, under humble conditions.  She and her husband support the household.  Their children are most important and the reason they work hard to provide them with better living conditions.  Silvia works as a housekeeper and also buys and sells firewood because there are many people in the area who are not able to buy gas stoves.  She wants to install electricity to provide her children with better living conditions, so she is asking for a loan, through FUSAI.  This will provide her children with better conditions for their development.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Otilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de limpieza, venta de colchones, venta de cosméticos, venta de chamarras, venta de fruta, librería, venta de chatarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Otilia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a mano de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace tres años, ya que sabía la técnica de tejido y la urgencia de conseguir un medio de generación de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "AZUCENAS" will begin its sixth loan cycle at the Pro Mujer women's program at the Los Andes Social Center.  The group is comprised of nine members and the president is Otilia.  All the members are involved in different businesses, such as a cleaning service, mattress sales, cosmetic sales, sweater sales, fruit sales, a bookstore and scrap metal sales.

The loan will benefit the small business owners, one of which is Otilia.  She has been involved in the Pro Mujer program for two loan cycles and joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  Otilia currently has a hand-knitted sweater business which she started three years ago.  She already knew how to knit and urgently needed a way to earn an income.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy wool which she will acquire at the traditional fairs in the city of El Alto.  Then she will make custom orders to sell to customers.  This form of working allows her to generate an income for her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the area of credit, health and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios luchadores uno de ellos es Claribel tiene la edad de 34 años, divorciada, su negocio es una pequeña distribuidora de venta de gaseosa y rifas en su comunidad y domicilio desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cajillas de gaseosa de diferentes sabores y tamaños como  coca cola litro. Medio litro, doce onzas, desechable, retornable, jugosa del valle, etc. María tiene la edad de 50 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Lester tiene la edad de 25 años su negocio es la venta de gaseosa coca cola.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three hard-working members, one of whom is Claribel, 34 and divorced.  She has a small business at home where she sells soda and lottery to the community.  She has been in business for eight years.

She is requesting a loan to buy crates of soda in different brands, flavors and sizes, such as Coca-cola and Jugosa del Valle in liter, half-liter, 12 ounces, disposable, and returnable bottles.  

María is 50 and sells fruits and vegetables and Lester is 25 and sells Coca-cola.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda in different brands, flavors and sizes.

loans.name: Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAÑANERAS”  iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de mantas, venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de calzados, librería, venta de artículos varios, limpieza de ropa, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura y venta de polleras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar de ayudante en un taller, posteriormente con el préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer decidió emprender su espacio de trabajo independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse en lo posible ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "MAÑANERAS" communal bank will be starting its fourteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Maria is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: making blankets, selling chickens, selling blankets, selling footwear, bookshop, selling general merchandise, laundry and selling appliances.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesswomen of which Maria is an example. She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she runs a sewing business and sells chickens. She learnt the business when she was working in a workshop and then with a loan from Pro Mujer she decided to set up her own independent work space.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy fabric which she will buy from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and will use to make goods to sell. This kind of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household as much as possible, since she lives with a partner and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Constructoras Group

texts.es: Martha es una de las tres integrantes que forma este grupo solidario, tiene la edad 32 años, acompañada, con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la venta de comida en un puesto que tiene ubicado en el km 14 desde hace 3 años y medio. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, cebolla, chiltoma. Tomate, ajo, para el desayuno compra de tortillas y leche agria. Jacqueline tiene la edad de 39 años su negocio es la venta de repostería y Rosa mujer de 34 años su negocio es una pulpería
texts.en:
Martha is one of the three members of this group.  She is 32, has a common-law husband and five children in her care.  She sells food for a living and has a stand located at Kilometer 14 where she has been in business for three and a half years.  She has been a client of the institution for a year; and the loan she is requesting is to buy basic staples such as rice, oil, beans, meat, chicken, pork, onions, peppers, tomato and garlic.  For breakfasts, she will buy tortillas and sour cream.

Jacqueline, 39, sells pastry and Rosa, 34, has a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora de 42 años de edad, casada, su negocio es una pulpería y un molino ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 19 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución desde hace 16 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para surtir más su pulpería y comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar trastes, galletas, marucha, papel higiénico, ace, cloro, gaseosas, queso, etc.
texts.en: Juana, 42, is a very hard-working woman who is married and runs a grocery store and grain mill in her home where she has been in business for 19 years.  For 16 years she has been a client of the institution and the loan she is requesting is to stock her grocery store and buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, bath soap, dish soap, cookies, Marucha soup, toilet tissue, bleach, chlorine, sodas, cheese, etc.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and staple goods.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Porfirio, en sus comidas rápidas, pues el con su anterior credikiva, compró al por mayor y de contado, cárnicos, verduras, embutidos y refrescos, con los cuales logró incrementar su producción, su capital, generando nuevas utilidades e ingresos familiares. Él envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo brindado, se ha incrementado y mejorado mi nivel de vida y el de mi familia. “ 
En la actualidad requiere aún más fondo de efectivo para atender la demanda navideña y de año nuevo que están muy cerca, para ello está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado insumos para comidas rápidas y refrescos. Con esta inversión tendrá a su clientela fija satisfecha y potencializará una nueva, acompañando esta inversión, de buen trato y precios cómodos, haciendo de su credikiva la razón de su éxito.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Porfirio with his fast food. With his last Kiva loan, he bought meat, vegetables, cold meats and soft drinks wholesale and upfront. With this he managed to increase his production and his capital, earning new profits and household income.

He sends the following message to his lenders: "Thank you very much for the support, it has increased and improved my quality of life and that of my family."

Currently he requires another cash fund to cater for the Christmas and New Year demand which is very close, so he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy wholesale supplies upfront for fast food and drinks. With this investment he can provide for his fixed customers and make the most of new ones, accompanying the investment with good service and good prices, making his Kiva loan the reason for his success.

loans.use: to buy wholesale and pay upfront for supplies to make fast food and drinks

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene la edad de 60 años, acompañado, su negocio es la venta de verduras desde hace 9 años, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 10 años, tiempo en el cual  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus cuotas. El crédito que está solicitando nuevamente es para empezar con un nuevo negocio de comprar materiales como hilo, tela, agujas, para la elaboración de cobertores, fundas, sobre cama, cortinas.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 60, is a very hard worker and lives with his common-law wife.  For nine years he has been selling vegetables and has been a client of the institution for ten years.  In that time he has proven himself to be very responsible paying back the loans.

The loan he is requesting is for his new business and it is to buy materials such as thread, fabric and needles to make bedspreads, covers and curtains.

loans.use: To buy materials such as thread, fabric, and needles to make bedspreads, covers and curtains.

loans.name: Marilena

texts.es: Marilena de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un pequeño negocio donde vende golosinas y antojitos como pastelitos de carne, yuca frita, pupusas, etc. desde hace 30 años con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marilena está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ingredientes para preparar los antojitos como: yuca, maíz, carne, verdura, frijoles, chicharrón, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio que le ha generado buenas ganancias, y así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en: Marilena is 56 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. She has a small business where she has sold snacks and foods such as meat pastries, fried yucca, pupusas, etc. for 30 years. With what she obtains from her business she is able to pay some household expenses. Marilena is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the foods such as: yucca, corn, meat, vegetables, beans, pork cracklings, etc. to be able to continue with her business which has generated good earnings for her. This way, she can have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy yucca, corn, meat, vegetables, beans, pork cracklings, etc.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 26-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin. She lives with her husband in a small house. Hadeel's husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Hadeel and her husband would like to have children, but they need some medical treatments first. 

Hadeel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to start some medical treatments to help them in the process of having children. By taking this loan, Hadeel and her husband will be able to take all the medical procedures needed to have children. Hadeel appears in the photo while she was applying the loan

loans.use: and her husband to start some medical treatments to help them in the process of having children

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Nada, and consists of 3 ladies (Nadia, Ans and Lamia) who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240000 YER from AMB. 

Nadia is 50 years old and lives with her family in Aden, Yemen. She is a very efficient woman because aside from caring for her family, she likes to work and thus help her family. She sells ladies clothes, incense, perfume and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. 

Nadia would like to expand her business.  She has applied for a second loan from AMB to buy clothes, incense and perfume for her business. The loan will give her the opportunity to improve the income from her business.  She is grateful to the Kiva lenders who funded the first loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense and perfume for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 61 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como calzado y vestuario, artículos de lencería y ropa para camas. Su negocio inició hace 31 años, cuando ella pensó en una alternativa generadora de ingresos con la cual apoyar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos hoy adultos, a quienes con su esfuerzo y trabajo les aportó para salir adelante, pues con solo los ingresos de su esposo resultaban insuficientes.   Sus ventas las realiza entre sus vecinos amigos y referidos por estos, que le han ayudado a incrementar su clientela. Ella ha recibido 21 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la cual se ha apoyado, para dar curso a su crecimiento y el de su negocio. Pues los financiamientos le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo. Su meta más adelante es tener una vitrina y estantería para organizarlo mucho más, mientras su mayor desafío es lograr una cartera de cuentas por cobrar más efectiva, para no perder dinero al hacerles créditos a clientes sin capacidad de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen calzado, ropa, femenina masculina e infantil y artículos para el hogar, aprovechando que se acercan las navidades y el año nuevo y debe tener inventario suficientes que resulten suficientes, para responderle a la creciente demanda de productos que amerita de esta temporada y los precios especiales de la oferta del mercado.
texts.en: Cecilia, who is 61, sells a range of goods such as footwear and clothing, lingerie and bed linen.  She set up her business 31 years ago as an alternative means of  generating an income to support her family which consisted of her husband and 4 now grown-up children.  Her determination and hard work enabled her to contribute to her family's livelihood, since what her husband earned was not enough.  She sells her goods among her neighbours and friends and people to whom they have recommended her, and this has helped her increase her clientele.  She has been granted 21 loans by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with whose support she has been able to make progress along with her business.  The funds have helped her to increase her working capital.  Her ambition for the future is to have a shop window and display case so that she can organise her business more, whilst her greatest challenge is to establish a portfolio of accounts to recover amounts owed more effectively and avoid losing money when selling on credit to customers who lack the ability to pay. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan which she will use to make bulk purchases of footwear, women's, men's and children's clothing and household goods (because Christmas and the New Year are coming) and she needs to have enough stock to be able to respond to the growing demand for goods at this time of year and the special prices of the supply side of the market.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of footwear, women's, men's and children's clothing and household goods

loans.name: Dúo La Joya Group

texts.es:
Dúo La Joya

Doña carlota de 60 años de edad desde hace mas de 31 años a la elaboración de embutidos como lo son chorizos y longanizas, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y buen sabor por eso es que tienen muy buenas ventas. Y ha sido a través de este trabajo que han salido adelante luchando por su familia. En el crédito anterior fue bien responsable y puntual en sus pagos solicita el crédito para comprar mas unsumos para la elaboracion y venta de embutidos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es mayor al capital que ella tiene para surtirles su nececidades, esperando que ustedes nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que usteds han sido de mucha ayuda para su negocio desde ya les agradese donde quiera que se encuentren.
texts.en:
La Joya Duo

Carlota is 60 years old. For more than 31 years, she has made sausages such as chorizos and longanizas. Her products are very good quality and taste good and that is why they have good sales. It has been through this work that they have been able to get ahead, fighting for the family. With the previous loan, she was very responsible and punctual with her payments. She is asking for the loan to buy more ingredients to make and sell the sausages, since the demand from her customers is higher than the capital she has to fill her needs. She hopes that you can help her again with the loan she has asked for since all of you have been a big help for her business. She is already grateful to you, wherever you are.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sausages (longanizas and chorizos)

loans.name: Abdiasis Hassan

texts.en: Abdiasis Hassan is 23 years old. He studies at University of Hargeisa, faculty of agriculture. He is a senior student, and he is preparing his graduation thesis.  He needs a laptop to write the thesis book. He has requested a laptop from Kaaba as a loan, and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Abdiasis will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 20 years old. He fights for his life and for his family. He lives in Ibb, Yemen.

Mustafa is a worker who has a low daily income.  His income is not enough to provide for his family. He has a small house that was established two years ago. Mustafa has been presented with an opportunity to be able to improve his house. This is of great importance to his family as they will be able to live in better conditions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan  from AMB to buy construction supplies to complete building his house.  He is grateful to the people who help with credit and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building her house as well as buying an oven to use in her house.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 54-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin city called Arrabeh. She lives with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. 

Faten's son works as an employee in a local firm; this is the only source of income for the family. Faten's daughter is still a student at a local university, where she studies medical laboratories. She would like to complete her studies and get a BA degree. 

Faten took a USD loan from FATEN to help her to pay the university fees for her daughter.  By taking this loan, Faten will be able to pay the studing costs for her daughter. 

Faten appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her daughter

loans.name: Blanca Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Blanca del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente del departamento de León bendecido por sus maravillosos paisajes llenos de variedad de árboles frutales y frondosos, flores con olor natural y ríos caudalosos.
Blanca se siente muyo orgullosa de haber nacido en este pequeño pueblo donde las personas se caracterizan por su amabilidad y hospitalidad.
Ella estudió la carrera de Administración de Empresas donde ya realizó los módulos para obtener el título universitario.
Trabaja en una Institución del estado como Responsable de Registro civil de las personas donde tiene cinco años de laborar.
En este momento está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con fondos Kiva para Gastos de promoción y pago de título universitario con el que tiene la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos.
Solicita a estas personas de buen corazón de Kiva le apoyen con este financiamiento para poder obtener su título, lo cual les agradece porque gracias a esto ha culminado su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Young Blanca del Carmen lives in the municipality of El Sauce, in the western department of León.  The area is blessed with wonderful scenery and is filled with a variety of leafy fruit trees, scented flowers, and flowing rivers.

Blanca is very proud of having been born in this small town, where the people are friendly and hospitable.

Blanca studied business administration at university and has now completed the necessary modules to pass her degree.

She has been working for a state institution for five years, in a registry office.

Blanca is now applying for a Ceprodel and Kiva loan in order to cover the costs of graduation and to pay for her degree certificate.  She hopes that having this degree will allow her to increase her income.

She is applying for this loan, hoping that the good-hearted people of Kiva will support her with this loan, so that she can complete her degree. Blanca is grateful as, thanks to this loan, she can finish her studies.

loans.use: to cover the costs of graduation and to pay for her degree certificate.

loans.name: Wilber Alexis

texts.es: Don Wilber es un padre responsable que se esfuerza por el bienestar de sus hijos, el se dedica al enderezado y pintura automotriz, en un pequeño taller, con sus ingresos mantiene las necesidades de su familia que la conforman dos hijos que estudian la escuela secundaria y su esposa quien se encuentra desempleada y se ocupa del orden del hogar. Don Wilber solicita este apoyo de crédito con el  fin de instalar cielo raso en su casa de habitación, para combatir un poco el calor que hace durante el día.
texts.en: Wilber is a responsible father who works hard for his children's well-being.  He makes a living doing-up and painting vehicles in a small workshop. Wilber's income allows him to pay for the things that his family needs.  He has two children, both at secondary school, while his wife is unemployed and looks after the home.  Wilber is applying for this loan in order to put a ceiling in his home, in order to keep out some of the heat during the day.

loans.use: to buy Plycem, ceiling panels,a and aluminium.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is 29 years old, married, and has two children; they live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is a hard-working taxi driver; his business is the main source of income for the family.  He gets a low daily income, which is not enough to cover his family's expenses. His taxi is not running well, and he lacks money to repair it. 

He is requesting a loan from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts to use for the taxi. 

This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours, and will enable him to take additional requests which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 35 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de confección de ropa especialmente jeans. Él es padre de 2 niños en las edades de 3 y 7 años, motor de su vida diaria. Manuel tiene una experiencia en el ramo de las confecciones aprendida de sus suegra, quien trabaja en esa actividad desde muy joven, y ella,  una vez lo invitó a vender la mercancía producida en el centro de la ciudad y desde ese mismo momento de gustó la tarea y dio curso a su negocio. Su línea principal son los pantalones de jeans, pero también produce ropa para damas, caballeros y niños de toda clase, la cuales distribuye directamente en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en Sincelejo, otra ciudad costera de Colombia. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito y sus compras de contado, haciendo funcionar su negocio todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  telas en mayor volumen, accesorio y pagará mano de obra también. Con este crédito Manuel podrá atender nuevos clientes, haciendo de su credikiva la mejor inversión.
texts.en: Manuel is 35 years old. He works making clothes, especially jeans. He is the father of two children, ages 3 and 7, the engine of his daily life. Manuel has experience in the area of making clothes. He learned from his mother in law, who has worked in this activity since she was very young. One day, she invited him to sell the merchandise that had been produced in the city center. Since that time, he liked the work and that started his business. His main line is jeans but he also produces all types of women's, men's and children's clothes. He distributes them directly to the stores in the city of Barranquilla and in Sincelejo, another coastal city in Colombia. He collects up front and sells on credit and pays for his purchases up front. He makes his business work every day from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Right now he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy fabric a greater volume of fabrics and accessories and pay for labor costs as well. With this loan, Manuel will be able to serve new customers, making his Kiva loan the best investment.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of fabric, accessories and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina de 40 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, dedicada específicamente a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de su familia.  Ella vive con sus padres, los cuales por su  avanzada edad se encuentran muy enfermos, a la vez comparte con sus hijos que aún son niños, dedicándoles tiempo y cariño, ya que ella comprende que la niñez pasa pronto y que debe aprovechar cada momento para compartir, conocer y darse cada día a sus seres queridos.

Desde muy pequeña, realiza los oficios del hogar, aprendió con su mamá y lo perfecciona cada día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para instalar una tienda en su casa. Tomando en cuenta que en la zona, no existe ese beneficio para los habitantes y tienen que recorrer grandes distancias desde sus casas de habitación hasta el pueblo más cercano.

Su propósito es vender productos de primera necesidad, canasta básica, granos etc. Garantizando beneficio a las personas y otros ingresos en el hogar.

La señora manifiesta que su propósito es luchar con sus padres hasta el final, también desea logros para sus hijos, verlos crecer y desarrollarse en diferentes aspectos, para que puedan desenvolverse dentro de la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rufina is 40 years old and a mother to three children.  Rufina takes care of the household chores and looks after her family.  She lives with her parents who are now very ill due to their advancing years.  Rufina shares her time between her parents and her children, giving them time and love. Rufina realises that childhood passes quickly and that she must enjoy every moment so that she can spend time with and get to know her much-loved children.

Rufina learned how to do the household chores and to be a mother from a young age; she continues to perfect this every day.

Rufina is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to open a shop in her house.  There are no other similar business in the local area and so inhabitants have to travel all the way into the nearest town.

Rufina's plan is to sell staple goods, grains, etc.  This will be of benefit to the people in the community, and will guarantee another income for Rufina's household.

Rufina tells us that she will continue to fight for her parents right up to the end.  She wants her children to achieve great things and to develop in different areas so that they can get on well in society.

loans.use: to open a shop inside her home.

loans.name: Neris Misael

texts.es:
Neris es un joven de 26 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con una experiencia de 11 años. Además, ejerce el oficio de albañil y lo hace desde hace 5 años; el cliente vive en su propia casa, que él mismo ha construido y con ayuda de los créditos adquiridos en la comunidad, para vivienda. Actualmente vive solo, y continua mejorando la vivienda y trabajando en la agricultura.

El préstamo será utilizado, para el mejoramiento de su vivienda; ya que esta, hecha de adobe y utilizara el crédito para repellar las paredes y de esta forma la vivienda tendrá más protección, antes de las lluvias y una mejor apariencia.

Los planes que tiene para el futuro, es tener la vivienda con todos los recursos básicos, en óptimas condiciones, adquirir otro préstamo para comprar un vehículo, casarse y tener una familia.
texts.en: Neris is a young man of 26 who has 11 years' experience of working in farming.  In addition, he has worked as a builder for 5 years. He lives in his own home, which he built himself with the help of housing loans obtained from the community.  He currently lives alone and is always improving his home and working in farming.  He will use the loan to carry out improvements on his home.  As it is made of adobe, he will use the loan to plaster the walls so the house will be better protected before the rains come and to make it look better.  His plans for the future are to have a home which has all the basic resources and which is in the best possible condition, to obtain another loan to buy a car and to get married and have a family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Argel Manuel

texts.es: Argel es casado y padre de dos hijos, originario de la ciudad de Teustepe. Tiene 31 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra cantera. Inicio su trabajo desde hace 14 años como chófer. Poco a poco fue ahorrando bastante dinero para comprar su propio camión que le ayuda hoy en día  generar su independencia  vendiendo así su propio producto. Su meta próxima es  seguir comprando y vendiendo piedras. Solicita el crédito para comprar más piedra cantera con el fin de aumentar su producto. Estima que el crédito le ayudará a obtener mejores ganancias y crecer el negocio. Su plan futuro es adquirir un nuevo crédito para invertir en un terreno.
texts.en:
Argel, 31, is married and has two children. He was born in the city of Teustepe. Argel is a salesman; he buys and sells quarry stones. He started to work as a driver fourteen years ago. Little by little, he saved until he had enough money to buy his own truck, with which he became independent and started selling his own product.

His short-term goal is to continue buying and selling stones. He is requesting a loan to buy more quarry stones in order to have more to sell. He believes that this loan will help him to make better profits and expand his business. In the future, he plans to request a new loan to invest in buying land.

loans.use: to buy more quarry stones.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 43-year-old, married man with three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells clothes and he has been in this business for a long time. He also lays bricks to earn additional income. He faces challenges of ever-changing customer preferences according to the trends and inadequate capital. His dreams are to educate his children to attain degrees and own a fashion house. Peter is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, él se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y a la comercialización de huevos, desde hace 3 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Miguel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para las gallinas y poder seguir con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel, who is 45,lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has bred laying hens and sold eggs for 3 years, which enables him to cover some of the household expenses.  Miguel is applying for a loan to buy vitamins and concentrate for his hens and to continue breeding as this is his only source of work.  This will, therefore, enable him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrate for his hens

loans.name: Dukundamatungo Dairy Co-Op

texts.en:
Patrick is 76 years old and the leader of the Dukundamatungo Dairy Co-op, which is now 170 members strong. This loan will benefit the entire co-op, which offers many services beyond selling milk, including veterinary care and an animal pharmacy.

Recent truck problems have slowed their activities, and it's prohibitively expensive to hire smaller cars twice a day to transport milk from the collection center to the industry. Dukundamatungo Dairy Co-op has requested this loan to buy a truck that can handle transporting the increased milk production to the industry and ultimately reduce the co-op's overhead costs. With profits from selling milk, they will reinvest in their businesses by buying coolers and restocking their animal pharmacy.

Around 90% of the Rwandan population is involved in subsistence agriculture, but many individuals have a difficult time generating money in this way without access to markets. Additionally, the income that comes from accessing markets is often the only way to pay for things like education and healthcare. Put simply, this truck allows the Dukundamatungo Dairy Co-op to turn their milk into cash, support their co-op, and better the lives of all 170 members.

video.title: Kiva Borrower   Dukundamatungo Dairy Coop from Rwanda

loans.use: To buy a truck for transporting milk

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a 68-year-old, married woman who has five children. She and her family live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she has spent eight years selling women’s ready-to-wear apparel. This has helped her to earn an income, which she has used to educate her children. She also does farming and tailoring. Filomena has always reaped tangible benefits and she even used these profits to improve her welfare and that of her family. Customers not paying on time is her major challenge while her plans are to expand to other areas. Filomena is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise and women’s ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise and women’s ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en: Asasio is a 32-year-old married man with three children, two of whom go to school. Asasio has been in the retail business for three years. He works six days a week and 13 hours a day. He is located in a rural area. Asasio started a business to become rich and wants money to buy sugar, rice and soap. Asasio hopes to educate his children. However, lack of capital is the challenge he faces. Asasio is a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and soap.

loans.name: Al-Amana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Amana, which consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. 

Jamila, 30, is married and has two children. She is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones, and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. 

She and her husband work hard to provide the children a good life. She works in a company for a limited salary. She has had a house for one year; she intends to remodel the inside of the house to make it more comfortable for her family. 

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber. 

She is grateful for the loan, and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and lumber, for her house.

loans.name: Kabako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  KABAKO    est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt à été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d'articles divers de boutique  à l’image de SIRA qui est la 2éme femme débout  dans la photo.
