Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  divers articles de boutique : lait en poudre, biscuits, sucre, thé et savons  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kabako group is made up of seven women. They are all married and are on average 38 years old, with five children on average. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Dioutiebougou in Bougouni.

They know each other through being neighbours, friends and business associates. In the interest of increasing their capital and improving their businesses, they are members of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their second loan and the previous loan was repaid in full. 

These women trade various shop items, like Sira, who is pictured standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she is planning to buy various shop items from the wholesalers in Bougouni: powdered milk, biscuits, sugar, tea and soap. Sira sells to individuals at the market and from home, both for cash and on credit. Most of her customers are women.

Sira is expecting to make an average of 25 000 CFA francs per month, which will be re-invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames au BEMABOUGOU un des villages de Loulouni du Sikasso, 3ème  la région de région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   ACHITAN   fait la de restauration dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt un sacs de 50 kg de riz, 2 sachets de cube maggi, 3 kg de sel de cuisine, et divers autres condiments pour la restauration. Elle vend en détail  sur place aux abords de la route ainsi que dans des  foires hebdomadaires de la commune à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
Most of the eight members of the Jiguiya group are married women, with an average age of 36 and five children on average. Most of them live in polygamous families in Bemabougou, one of the villages in Loulouni in Sikasso, the third administrative region in Mali.

This is the third loan they have requested from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Achitan, a group member, has a catering business. She is pictured sitting second from the right.

Achitan is planning to use her loan to buy a 50kg sack of rice, two packets of Maggi stock cubes, 3kg of cooking salt and various other condiments for catering. She sells to individuals from a stall on the side of the road, as well as at the local weekly markets. Her customers include both men and women, and pay in cash. 

Achitan is hoping to make 11 000 CFA francs on average, part of which will go towards paying the loan and its interest, and part of which will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Issouf Kossa

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSOUF est né vers Janvier 1984 à Bamako. Marié avec un enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Loulouni ville (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il possède un kiosque afin de bien mener son activité de commerce. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 4ème prêt.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une importantes quantités de téléphones portables et accessoires. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako sur commande et souvent en déplacement pour des cas particuliers. Il les revend au comptant, sur commande, en gros et en détail dans sa boutique à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte augmenter son capitale pour aménager un endroit beaucoup plus accueillant afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Issouf was born in around 1984 in Bamako. He is married with one child, and lives in a traditional family in Loulouni (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Issouf has a shop in order to run his business successfully. His experience in this area has given him a good reputation and he receives orders from customers. To obtain the resources he needs to satisfy his customers, he collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso and this is his fourth loan.

This loan will enable Issouf to buy a large quantity of mobile phones and accessories. He buys his supplies in Bamako to order and often makes trips for special cases. He then resells his products for cash to order, in bulk and to individuals, from his shop in Loulouni. His customers include both men and women. 

With this loan, Issouf is hoping to earn an average of 100 000 CFA francs per month. This income will enable him to pay the interest on the loan, meet most of his expenses and reinvest in his business.

Issouf is hoping to increase his capital to make his shop more welcoming in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories.

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr:
Mr ALY est né vers1963 à Brimado, région de Sikasso. Il vit chez lui même à Loulouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans une famille traditionnelle.
Il mène les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales depuis maintenant 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya également 7 ans, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 50 sacs de 50 kg de céréales. Il s’approvisionne à Loulouni ainsi que dans les villages environnants. Les ventes sont faites à Loulouni ainsi qu’à Sikasso. Les céréales achetées sont stockées dans son magasin à Loulouni pendant une bonne période.  Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aly was born in around 1963 in Brimado, in the Sikasso region. He lives in his own house in Loulouni (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) in a traditional family.

Aly has been trading cereals for seven years now. His experience in this area has given him a good reputation and he receives orders from a range of customers. 

In order to obtain the resources he needs to satisfy his customers, Aly has been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, also for seven years. His previous loans have all been repaid in full.  

This loan will enable Aly to buy fifty 50kg sacks of cereals. He buys his supplies in Loulouni and in the surrounding villages. He sells his goods in Loulouni and Sikasso. The cereals he buys are stored in his shop in Loulouni for a long period of time. His customers include both men and women. 

With this loan, Aly is hoping to earn an average of 80 000 CFA francs per month. This income will enable him to pay the interest on the loan and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI  sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames au BEMABOUGOU un des villages de Loulouni du Sikasso, 3ème  la région de région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  WOLORE fait le commerce d’habillements dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 30 complets pour enfants qu’elle revend en détail  sur place à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Most of the members of the Sinignessigui group are married women. On average, they are 36 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Bemabougou, one of the villages in Loulouni in Sikasso (the 3rd administrative region of Mali).
 
This is the first loan they have requested from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Wolore, a group member, buys and sells clothing. She is pictured sitting on the far right of the photo.

With her loan, Wolore is hoping to buy 30 outfits for children that she will resell to individuals for cash, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

She is hoping to make 12 000 CFA francs on average, part of which will go towards paying the loan and its interest, and part of which will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Dona Francisca tiene 63 años de edad  habita en la comunidad de nombre el escondido ahí vive con su hijo, la nuera y dos nietos ,ella es propietaria de una pequeña finca de café  que  la heredo al fallecer su esposo con la ayuda de su hijo la ha sacado adelante y cada año recoge la cosecha de café y la vende lo que le permite sostener su hogar y hacer mejoras en la misma finca, ademas también  cosecha banano que ese es otra fuente de ingreso. En la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica lo que es triste pues le gustaría que sus nietos pudieran jugar y hacer tareas ya que ellos actualmente para poder iluminarse usan candil y este es perjudicial a la salud de todos. Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para el sistema solar y así tener energía limpia en su hogar.
texts.en: Francisca, who is 63, lives in the community known as El Escondido with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.  She owns a small coffee plantation which she inherited from her late husband.  With her son's help, she has continued the business and each year harvests the coffee and sells it to support the household and carry out improvements to the plantation.  In addition, she also grows bananas as an additional source of income.  In the community there is no electricity, which is sad because she would like her grandchildren to be able to play and do their homework without having to use candles which are detrimental to everyone's health.  For this reason she is applying for a loan to buy a solar home system and have clean energy in her home.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system for her home

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur YACOUBA est vers1983 à Gonzanadougou. Marié sans enfant il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Loulouni ville (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il possède un kiosque afin de bien mener son activité de commerce des pièces de rechange et de réparation de moto. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des clients de tous les coin de Loulouni. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, Mr Yacouba a sollicité un prêt avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier cycle de prêt.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechanges pour moto. Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso sur commande et souvent en déplacement. Il les revend au comptant, sur commande, en détail dans sa boutique à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Yacouba was born in around 1983 in Gonzanadougou. He is married with no children, and lives in a nuclear family in Loulouni (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Yacouba has a kiosk from which he runs his motorcycle spare part and repair business. His experience in this area has given him a good reputation and he receives customers from across Loulouni. 

In order to obtain the resources he needs to satisfy his customers, Yacouba has requested a loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is his first loan cycle.

The loan will enable Yacouba to buy spare parts for motorcycles. He buys his supplies in Sikasso to order and this often requires travelling. He then resells his products to order to individuals for cash from his shop in Loulouni. His customers include both men and women. 

With this loan, he is hoping to earn an average of 40 000 CFA francs per month. This income will enable him to pay the interest on the loan, meet most of his expenses and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorbikes.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame  Hawa est âgée de 37 ans,  mariée  et   mère de 7 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages  au quartier Darsalam (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle débuta très tôt les activités commerciales auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière, elle évolue seule pour mener plusieurs activités mais finit par faire le commerce de cartes téléphoniques. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle, sa force de vente est due à son courage mais également à son accueille clientèle. 
Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce, afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois, âpres 1er prêt individuel bien remboursé. Elle est à son 2ème prêt qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 500 cartes prépayées de. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes agrées. 
Madame  Hawa vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Hawa is 37 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives in a traditional family with other households in the Darsalam neighbourhood (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having left school due to social circumstances, she entered business at a young age, helping her mother sell condiments. After several years working alongside her mother, she began her own business and tried several areas before settling on phone cards. Hawa has a wide customer base. Her good sales skills are due to her energy as well as the welcome she gives her customers. 

In order to strengthen her business and meet customer demand, Hawa is requesting a loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months and has already received one individual loan that was fully repaid. This is her second loan, and she intends to use it to purchase 500 prepaid phone cards. She buys her goods locally from approved wholesalers.

Hawa sells for cash to a mixed clientele. She is hoping to make 100 000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame  Rokia  est âgée de 34 ans,  mariée  et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle   avec son mari et d’autres ménagés  au quartier Médine  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée l’école très tôt, elle commença à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui était une grande vendeuse de condiment de son quartier.  Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit seule à  mener   le commerce de céréales, draps pour enfin faire le commerce d’habits, activité qu’elle depuis 10 ans, elle jouit d’une grande clientèle rurale aussi bien que citadine. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité se sa marchandise mais surtout à son  prix abordable. 
Dans  le but de diversifier son activité elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 84 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 5 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter  20 pièces de pagnes bazin et wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou. 
Madame Rokia  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Rokia is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband and other households in the Médine neighbourhood (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having left school very early, she began to help her mother, who has a good business selling condiments in the neighbourhood. After several years working alongside her mother, Rokia began her own business activities, selling cereals and sheets before moving on to clothing. She has now been in this business for ten years and has a large clientele in both the countryside and the town. The success of her business is due to the quality of her merchandise and above all her affordable prices.

Rokia is requesting this loan in order to diversify her business. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 84 months and has received four solidarity loans and five individual loans that have all been fully repaid. This is her sixth individual loan, and she will use it to buy 20 lengths of traditional bazin and wax cloth pagnes. She buys her supplies locally at Ségou. 

Rokia sells her goods for cash and on credit to a mostly female clientele. She is hoping to make 45 000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Abass

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abass  est âgé de 38 ans,  mariée  et   père de 3 enfants, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages  au quartier Médine  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant fréquenté l’école coranique, il commença dès son tendre enfance, à faire le commerce auprès de ses parents qui étaient des commerçants depuis plusieurs générations. 
Après beaucoup d’année d’apprentissage, il évolua seul pour faire le même commerce. Il vend les articles divers de boutique depuis 12 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est à la maitrise du rouage de l’activité mais surtout à son sens élevé des affaires. 
Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce, afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, il  sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Il  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois, après 3 prêts individuels  bien remboursés. Il  est à son 4ème prêt, qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter 5 sacs de sucre, 10 bidons d’huile et 5 cartons de pâtes alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Monsieur Abass  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à fructifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Abass is 38 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives in a traditional family with other households in the Médine neighbourhood (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Abass attended koranic school before helping out his parents with their business from a very young age. His family have been traders for several generations. 

After many years of apprenticeship, Abass began running the same business in his own right. He has been selling various shop items for 12 years and has a large customer base. His sales skills are good thanks to his mastery of the business cycle and above all his finely-turned business sense. 

In order to strengthen his business and meet customer demand, Abass is requesting this new loan. He has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 36 months and has received three individual loans that have all been fully repaid. This is his fourth loan and he is planning to use it to buy five sacks of sugar, ten cans of oil and five boxes of pasta. He buys his supplies locally. 

Abass sells his goods for cash and on credit to a mostly female clientele. He is hoping to make 40 000 CFA francs per month, which will help him repay the loan and make his business productive.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Brehima  est âgé de 34 ans, marié et père  de 2 enfants, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et frères  au quartier Bagadadji  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Technicien en bâtiment de formation, il mène des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle qui vend des articles de boutiques. Après plusieurs années passés à son côté, il finit par embrasser la même activité. Il fait ce commerce depuis 3 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à sa maitrise du rouage de l’activité mais surtout à son sens élevé des affaires ainsi que son dynamisme. 
 Dans  le but de faire plus de stockage afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, il sollicite ce prêt. Il est  à son 1er prêt individuel  qu’il compte utiliser  pour acheter 10 sacs de sucre, 10 bidons d’huile, 15 cartons de cubes maggi. Il s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes.
Monsieur Brehima vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée mixte.  il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Brehima is 34 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in a traditional family with his parents and brothers in the Bagadadji neighbourhood (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

A building technician by training, he spent many years working in his uncle’s business selling shop goods. After this, he opened up his own business in the same field. He has been running this business for three years and has many customers. His sales skills are good thanks to his mastery of the business cycle and above all his finely-turned business sense. 

Brehima is requesting this loan in order to stock more goods to meet customer demand. This is his first individual loan and he is planning to use it to buy ten sacks of sugar, ten cans of oil and 15 boxes of Maggi cubes. He buys his goods locally from wholesalers.

Brehima sells his goods for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.  He is hoping to make 90 000 CFA francs per month, which will help him repay the loan and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assetou  est âgée de 54 ans,  mariée  et   mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Angoulême II de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée l’école pour se marier par volonté parentale, elle commença très tôt à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait  des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit seule à  mener la vente de jus de fruits et glace.  Elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise, bien préparée et soigneusement mise dans des emballages propres. Pour faire son jus :
 Elle a besoin de 3 kg de sucre, 1kg de gingembre, 3 sachets de jus de poudres, 5 litres d’eau. 
Dans  le but d’avoir un équipement  neuf  afin de sécuriser son congélateur, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel   qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter  1 stabilisateur et 1 convertisseur. Elle s’approvisionne en équipement et matière première  sur place. 
Madame  Assetou  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Madame Assetou is a 54-year-old, married woman with five children.  She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Angoulême II district of Ségou (the fourth-largest, administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Assetou left school early to get married, following her parent's wishes.  She then started selling spices, seasonings and ingredients alongside her mother.  After several years of apprenticeship with her mother, she began selling fruit juice and ice.  She has 20 years of experience in this business and has very strong sales figures.  This is due to the high quality of her products, which she produces with care, and stocks in clean containers.  To make her juice, Assetou uses 3kgs of sugar, 1kg of ginger, 3 sachets of juice powder and 5 litres of water.

Assetou has requested this loan from the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to purchase new equipment which will ensure the reliable running of her freezer.  This will be her first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and she will use it to buy an electrical stabiliser and an electrical converter.  She buys all her equipment and ingredients locally.

Assetou sells her goods for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers.  She expects to earn 50,000 francs CFA a month and will use her earnings to repay her loan and help her husband with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment to produce fruit juice and ice for sale.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Don patricio de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y maicillo desde hace 30 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ya tiene mucha clientela establecida por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, Don patricio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su siembra y así poder obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Patricio is 58 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 13 and 15 years old.  He makes a living in agriculture, particularly in planting corn and sorghum.  He has done this for 30 years and sells his products in the different markets that are located near his home.  He already has many established customers due to the quality of his products and good prices.  

Don Patricio is asking for a loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, etc., so that he can continue his planting and thus be able to get more earnings that will help him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамаре 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Тамары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тамара занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,200 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тамары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 9 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тамара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Tamara is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Tamara has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Tamara practices livestock breeding. She started this business 25 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,200 som (KGS). Thanks to Tamara's hard work, she currently has on 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 9 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Tamara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers to increase the size of her herd. Tamara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Sail

texts.ru:
Саид позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 52 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Живёт он в небольшом сельском городке. Саид закончил курсы вождения микроавтобуса, после чего стал работать шофёром. Он взял в аренду микроавтобус и стал предоставлять услуги для перевозки людей и разных вещей. И на сегодня это дело является стабильным бизнесом Саида, который приносит ему стабильный доход. Жена Саида домохозяйка, она растит ребёнка. Саид и его жена стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своего ребёнка всем необходимым.
Так как у Саида нет собственного микроавтобуса, ему приходится тратить денежные средства на аренду данного транспорта. Но Саид хочет купить собственный транспорт, чтобы развивать свой бизнес, не выплачивая лишних средств на аренду. Для того, чтобы купить микроавтобус Саиду необходима большая сумма денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку микроавтобуса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, в следствие которой улучшится качество жизни его семьи.
texts.en:
Said is an optimistic, hardworking fellow of 52. He is married, has one young child, and lives in a small rural town. He completed training to be a minivan driver, and began to work as a chauffeur. He rented a minivan and began to operate a taxi and delivery service. This has become a stable business that enables Said to earn a solid income. Said’s wife is a housewife; she takes care of their baby. Said and his wife are doing all they can to provide for all of their child’s needs.

Since Said does not own his own minivan, he has to spend money leasing a vehicle. He wants to buy his own vehicle; if he wants to expand his business, he can’t afford to pay the expenses of leasing. To buy a minivan, Said needs a large sum of money. So he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy a minivan. He thanks Arvand in advance for their support, which will result in an improved quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a minivan

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат и ее муж уже давно занимаются земледелием. Земледелие является основным источником дохода семьи. От полученного дохода они обеспечивают 4 детей. Саодат дополнительно работает в средней школе преподавателем, так как она имеет педагогическое образование. Саодат очень трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому она справляется и с педагогической деятельностью и с бизнесом. Она в основном выращивает картошку. Саодат и ее семья живут бедно, несмотря на то, что они работают упорно. Саодат даже не в состоянии проводить свадебное торжество своей дочери, которая скоро выходит замуж. Саодат очень нуждается вашей финансовой поддержки. Она обещала своей дочери проводить ее свадьбу отлично. Этот займ поможет сделать счастливой ее дочь. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saodat and her husband have been farming for many years. Farming is the primary source of income for their family; the income they earn provides for their 4 children. Saodat also works as a high school teacher, since she has a teaching degree. Saodat is a very hardworking woman, and is able to manage working at both her teaching job and their farming business. She mainly grows potatoes. Despite how hard they work, she and her family are poor. Saodat is not in a position to pay for a wedding for their daughter, who is getting married. Saodat very much needs your financial support. She has promised her daughter that she will have a wonderful wedding. This loan will bring her daughter happiness. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To make a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Kaliyakan

texts.ru: Калиякан 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Калиякан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калиякан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калиякан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калиякан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калиякан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку трактора.
texts.en: Kaliyakan is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Kaliyakan has a secondary education.As the main source of income for her family, Kaliyakan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 22 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kaliyakan's hard work, she currently has on 4 milk cows, 2 horses and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Kaliyakan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Kaliyakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a tractor.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Kenjebubu

texts.ru: Кенжебубу, 65 лет , разведена, имеет 6 детей. Образование-среднее. С 1990 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Кенжебубу смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 20 овец, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 4,5 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Кенжебубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Кенжебубу планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем Кенжебубу хочет улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Kenjebubu is 65, divorced, and has 6 children. She has a high school diploma. Since 1990 she has been engaged in farming and animal husbandry. She started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). Kenjebubu has succeeded in expanding her farming and livestock business; she now has 1 dairy cow, 2 calves, and 20 sheep. She also has 4.5 hectares of land on which she grows beans and hay. With the goal of expanding her business, Kenjebubu turned to the Bai-Tushum & Partners micro-lending bank for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. Kenjebubu plans to put the proceeds obtained from the loan into increasing her livestock herd, and she hopes to improve her family’s general welfare.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, 33, is a hardworking woman with 1 child aged. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a salon and also sells refreshments in order to  earn money to support her family. Like all good mothers, she desires to educate her children through university. The high cost of rent and ever-changing customer preferences are her major challenges. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house in which to live, and her business plan is to set up a beauty parlor. Christine is requesting a loan to buy cement and sand to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, 28, is a married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in electronics and his business is located on a busy street, thus attracting many customers. He also trades in salt since the salt lake is nearby, and he has a motorcycle for transport business as additional income source. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children through university and build a good residential house for the family. He is challenged by inadequate capital to meet the demand, while his business plans are to become a leading electronic supplier in the district and buy two more motorcycles for his business. Julius intends to use this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Selestino

texts.en:
Selestino is a 60-year-old widower with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail shop business for four years, and works seven days a week; it is located in the rural area.  He also does farming as an additional income source.  

Inadequate capital poses a threat to his business, while his desire is to own a wholesale shop.

Selestino will use the loan to buy sugar, soda, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soda, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia, 42, is a married woman with seven children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a clothes-selling business, and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She also practices farming in order to earn more income. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her business, while her desire is to own a modern boutique. Flavia is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past four years, Fatmata has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and take care of her parent. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She is very hardworking and desires to improve her standard of living

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more pure water, cigarettes, biscuits and assorted drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water, cigarettes, biscuits and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 48 years old and married with two children. She runs a cookery business in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She began this business to take care of her children's welfare. She's been in this business for eight years and sells local food within her community. She says that the main problem in her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and cooking oil to expand her business for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business even more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is a 27-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. For the past 10 years, Fatmata has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Adama from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. In 2010, Adama established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her life and her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is an electricity power supply.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase a generator to expand her mobile charging business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a generator to expand her mobile-charging business.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Doña rosa de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes pero le ayudan en algunas ocasiones en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al cultivo de tilapias (peces) desde hace 4 años tiene mucha clientela que la busca porque vende las tilapias a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar alimentos para engordar tilapias y poder mejorar el estanque donde realiza el cultivo que es el que muestra la fotografía, para seguir con su trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41, lives in her own house with her husband.  They have three children who are independent at this point but sometimes help out with household expenses.  Rosa has made her living raising tilapia for 4 years.  She has a lot of clients that seek her out because she sells at a good price.  With her earnings and help from her husband and children they have managed to pay off some household expenses.  

Rosa is seeking a loan so she can buy food to fatten up her tilapia and improve their tank (shown in the photo), continue with her work, and be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food for her tilapia and improve their fish tank.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras Con Exito Group

texts.es: La socia marta Judith y es muy puntual con sus pagos y responsable en el negocio que tienen, desde muy temprano ella emprende sus labores ofreciendo su producto de cosmeticos de casa en casa tocando las puertas de las persona ella como actividad secundaria también se dedica a la elaboracio de cajas de madera para empacar lechuga esta muy contenta porque su negocio le a sido de mucha ayuda para el sosten de su familia, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en cosmeticos y compra de madera para seguir con la elaboracion de cajas para transportar verduras esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Marta Judith is described as a person who always makes her payments on time, and operates her businesses responsibly. For a long time now, she has been selling cosmetics door-to-door. Marta also has another business, which is making wood crates to pack and transport lettuce. She says that she is very happy because her businesses have helped a lot to support her family.

Marta Judith is requesting this loan to buy more cosmetic merchandise, and to buy wood so that she can continue to make crates to transport vegetables. She hopes to receive the loan that she has requested.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell and to buy wood to make crates for transporting vegetables.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa  de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella trabaja en un vivero que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder instalar en su vivienda tubos con agua potable ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita el crédito y poder comprar cemento, tubos, y pago de mano de obra y así poder tener su propia agua y así ella y su hijo pueden vivir mejor.
texts.en: Teresa, 51, lives in her own house with her son.  She works in a garden center near where she lives.  With the income from her job she's able to pay for some of her household expenses.  She wants to improve her house so she's seeking a loan to put in pipes for drinking water.  She can't afford them on what she makes.  She'll use the loan to buy cement, pipes, and labor.  Then she'll have her own water and she and her son will be able to live better.

loans.use: to buy cement and pipes and pay for labor.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hija. Él  se dedica a la venta de pescado seco desde hace 5 años, los días de semana se dedica a la agricultura y los fines de semana a la venta de pescado, que lo moviliza en un vehículo que tiene a su propiedad.  Su esposa y la hija se dedican al quehacer doméstico y también le ayudan con la venta de pescado,  ya que son una familia muy unida.

Además, de vender pescado, se dedica a la agricultura desde los 15 años de edad, expresa que aprendió agricultura de sus padres que también se dedicaban a dicho oficio.

El dinero financiado será invertido en la venta de pescado seco, de esta manera podrá surtir más su negocio, y aumentara las ventas. 

Èl tendrá una evidente mejora en sus ingresos económicos,  producto de la ganancia del comercio,   y de este modo podrá invertir en otras necesidades básicas del hogar.

El señor Saturnino planea para un futuro comprar otro vehículo, para agilizar el comercio e irse extendiendo a otros municipios.
texts.en:
Saturnino, 58, lives with his wife and daughter. He has sold dried fish for 5 years. On weekdays he is devoted to agriculture and on weekends he sells fish with a vehicle he has on his property. His wife and daughter are engaged in housework and also help him with the sale of fish as they are a very close-knit family. 

In addition to selling fish, he has been earning his living in agriculture since he was 15 years of age. He states that his parents taught him agriculture because they were also engaged in this trade.

This loan will be invested in selling dried fish which will allow him to grow his business and increase sales.

He will have a clear improvement in their income as a result of this gain in trade and, thus, may invest in other basic household needs. 

Saturnino plans to purchase another vehicle in the future to facilitate trade and spread his business to other municipalities.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell to grow his business and increase his sales.

loans.name: Saibatu

texts.en: Meet 49-year-old Sabatu from Waterloo, a rural area in Freetown. Sabatu is married and has four children. For the past five years, Sabatu has been running her used clothing business. She began her business to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. Sabatu says that her business' main challenge is the lack of capital. Sabatu requires a loan to buy more used clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Sabatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: José Edenilson

texts.es:
José es un joven de 24 años de edad, es padre de un hija,  él trabaja como empleado en una venta de lácteos y tiene una experiencia en ventas de año y medio; y su compañera de vida se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y ropa. Èl vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 4 años de edad, que actualmente se encuentra estudiando parvularia.

 Ademas, de su trabajo en ventas de los productos lácteos, ejerce el oficio de mecánico y los días libres trabaja con un tío en enderezado y pintura de vehículos, de esta manera mejoran sus ingresos económicos y puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar productos cosméticos y ropa para la venta. De esta manera se estará, apoyando a que el negocio de la familia tenga un crecimiento económico, que vendrá a mejorar la calidad de vida.

Espera  para futuro adquirir un crédito, que le permita montar su propia venta de lácteos y tener un local mas surtido de productos cosméticos y de ropa.
texts.en:
José is a young man of 24 and the father of one daughter.  He is employed in a dairy sales business and has a year-and-a-half experience in sales.  His life partner sells cosmetics and clothing.  José lives with his partner and 4-year-old daughter who is currently in nursery school.  

In addition to his dairy sales job, José is also a mechanic and on his off days works with an uncle doing vehicle paint and body work.  Through their work José  and his partner are increasing their income and are able provide their family a better quality of life.  

The loan José is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.  This will help the family business grow economically and bring better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Teresa Elizabeth

texts.es: Teresa de 36 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 años y 18 años de edad. Teresa es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y visionaria. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de variedad de verduras y de esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia desea construir un pequeño cuarto dentro de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para construir el cuarto lo antes posible y dar a su familia condiciones más cómodas.
texts.en: Teresa is 36 years old and lives in a home of her own with her family, consisting of her husband and two children, ages 15 and 18.  Teresa is a hardworking, enterprising woman of vision who has been selling a variety of vegetables for the past 10 years and earns her living and helps with the household finances in this way.  She wants to build a small room in her house so she can improve her family’s living conditions, so she is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, so she can buy galvanized metal and lumber to build the room as soon as possible and provide more comfortable conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lucila Concepción

texts.es:
Doña Lucila Concepción es una señora de 47 años, madre de cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar, habita en la comunidad El Pavón ubicada a 7 km del municipio de El Jicaral.
Es una mujer que fue criada en el seno de una familia campesina donde se dedican a la agricultura de granos como es frijoles y maíz para su comercialización y consumo en el hogar.
Doña Lucila optó por estudiar la carrera de Magisterio para dar clases a niños de primaria con el fin de sobresalir y tener un mejor desarrollo económico y no quedarse estancada en el campo.
Hoy tiene 22 años de ser maestra en la escuela de su misma comunidad, profesión que le ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Lucila en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito y se presentó por primera vez a la oficina de Ceprodel, ya que escuchó decir de unos inversionistas del extranjero llamados Kiva que financian a través de Ceprodel a personas de escasos recursos y tal es su caso que lo necesita para compra de medicamentos, realización de ultrasonidos, pago de consultas médicas, ya que últimamente se ha sentido mal de salud y no puede cubrir este gasto con su salario.
texts.en:
Lucila Concepción is 47 years old and the mother of four school-aged children.  She lives in the El Pavon community, located 7 km from the town of El Jicaral.

She was raised on a family farm where they grew basic grains, such as beans and corn, for sale and personal consumption.

Lucila decided to study to become a teacher so she could teach elementary school children and get ahead and develop economically, so she doesn’t get stuck on the farm.

She has been teaching at the same community school for 22 years, a profession that has allowed her to improve her living conditions and get her children ahead. 

Lucila needs this loan and went to CEPRODEL because she heard about some foreign lenders from Kiva who help people of limited resources, which is her case.  She needs the money to buy medicine, have an ultrasound, and pay for medical consultation, as she has been feeling sick lately and can’t cover these expenses with her salary.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Carmina Lizeth

texts.es: Carmina de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad, desde hace 3 años posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la calidad de sus productos, Carmina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, sopas, refrescos, etc. para poder así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carmina, 34, lives with her husband and her two children aged 17 and 10 years old. For the past three years, she has had a store located in her home. She has many customers who prefer her store for the good prices and the quality of her products. Carmina is requesting a loan to buy more basic staple foods such as oil, sugar, sweets, soups, soft drinks, and more to obtain better profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic staple goods such as oil, sugar, sweets, soups, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur  BAKARY est âgé de 60 ans et vit avec son épouse et ses deux enfants dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
BAKARY,  s’est très vite  s’intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des poussins de race améliorée. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant  volaille. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter des poussins qu’ ‘il  élèvera pendant deux mois avant de les revendre aux grossistes  au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
BAKARY  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen bimestriel de 75.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr Bakary is 60 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in the region of Koulikoro.  

Bakary started looking for money-making business ideas early on, and began buying and selling pure-bred chickens.  He learned his trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a successful poultry trader.  

In order to satisfy the needs of his growing numbers of customers, Bakary works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be his third individual loan, and will be used to buy chicks which he will raise for two months, before selling them on, for cash, to a mixed group of wholesalers.  

Bakary expects to earn a bimonthly average of 75,000 francs CFA, and  will use his earnings for repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is running a bakery to make a living, with the help of her husband as baker. She has been doing this for more than three years and she earns well for their daily living. She always find ways to augment her business. Using her previous loan from GDMPC, she was able to buy new baking equipment and tools and it has successfully been repaid. 

Currently, she borrowed a loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook to offer more variety of baked bread and pastries. She always wants to improve her business and their general living standard as well.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Monhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Monhbold is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife Enhbayar is 25 and currently stays home taking care of their 2-year-old son.

 Monhbold has been providing an inter-city public transportation service between Ulaanbaatar and Suhbaatar province center since 2010. He is a well-experienced, careful driver. He is well-known among the residents for his reliable and comfortable service. He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to replace the heating system of his house in order to avoid burning a lot of coal or firewood during winter and to stay warm and comfortable with his family. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to replace the heating system of his house

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.ru: Анорхон кредитуется в ИМОНе первый цикл. Она нуждающиеся  женщина в финансовой поддержке. Анорхону 54 года. Она вдова и одна воспитывает своих 2 детей. После смерти мужа она пережила много тягости жизни. Анорхон очень нуждалась в деньгах. Анорхон начала свой бизнес купле продажей молока. Она покупала молоко из местных жителей и продавала на рынке. У нее был маленький доход, и с трудом справлялась с расходами. Таким образом, она вырастила своих детей. Постепенно она развевала бизнес. Данное время она занимается скотоводством. С полученного дохода она построила сарай и начала частичный ремонт дома. Она хочет завершить ремонт, но не имеет достаточно денег для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Anorkhon is in her first loan cycle with IMON.  She is in need of financial support.  She's 54, a widow, and is raising two children by herself.  After her husband died, she lived through a lot of hardship and was in great need of money, so she started her own business buying and selling milk.  She bought milk from local residents and sold it at market.  She had a small income and managed expenses with difficulty, and through it was raising her children.  She gradually developed the business and now raises cattle.  She used her income to build a barn and started to fix the house up here and there.  

Anorkhon would like to finish the repairs but she doesn't have enough money to buy building materials like cement, lumber, etc., so she's seeking a loan of 3000 somoni.  She awaits your beneficence.

loans.use: to buy building materials including cement and lumber to repair her house.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 48 years old and married with four children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Elisa has borrowed and repaid twenty-one small loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from 'trisikad' (three-wheeled vehicle) transportation.

Elisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman helps his wife operate their own general store while he farms to make a living. During his free time, he repacks goods and watches the store when his wife buys stock in town. He borrowed money from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to resell. He hopes to increase their income and have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling natural medicines.  The business is located in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to increase her stock of medicines to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for thirty years. Alejandra earns additional income from charcoal retailing.

Alejandra has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream for the future is to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is 60 years old and married with five children.

Aniceta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aniceta has borrowed and repaid 24 small loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from 'trisikad' (three-wheeled vehicle) transportation.

Aniceta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old and married with three children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid twenty-two small loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Corazon aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
BREHIMA est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son époux à SIMIDJI dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
BREHIMA   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de SIMIDJI et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins un temps. Il vend  en détail et en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
BREHIMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
BREHIMA, age 41, lives with his five children and his wife in SIMIDJI, sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, in the KOULIKORO region.

BREHIMA did not have the opportunity to go to school. Early on, he developed an interest for income-generating activities, namely the purchase, storage and sale of cereals. He learned this activity alongside his maternal uncle who was once an important cereals merchant. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. Having correctly repaid his first loan, he is now seeking a 2nd individual loan to buy three tonnes of cereals from local producers in SIMIDJI and surrounding areas, which he will keep in storage for a while. He sells wholesale and retail to a clientele that consists of resellers from larger cities such as Bamako, in OUELESSEBOUGOU.

BREHIMA hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay the loan and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la placita que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gasto de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas ropa por mayor como: blusas, camisas, faldas, short, pantalones, etc. y asi poder surtir con mas mercadería su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 and lives in her own house with her two children, aged 14 and 20. She has been selling clothes for several years and her business is in the small square near her house. She uses what she makes from her sales to cover her household expenses.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale clothing such as blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts and trousers. This will mean that she can supply her business with more goods and so increase her profits, and in this way provide more financial security for her children.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing such as blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts and trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus dos hijos y sus suegros, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pupusas  desde hace 1 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene con los clientes a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, frijoles, tomates, etc.  y asi poder seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client lives in a home of her own along with her two children and her in-laws.  She has been making and selling pupusas out of her home for one year and has many customers because or her good prices and friendly service.  She uses her earnings to pay her household expenses.  This client is asking for a loan to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, corn, beans, tomatoes, etc.  This way she can continue her business and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 4 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de sus productos, los buenos precios y la calidad de  ello,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas zapatos por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, y así poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: This client lives in her own home with her two children and husband. She has sold shoes for 4 years and her business is located within their residence. She has a lot of customers because of her variety of products, good prices, and their quality. She makes her sales and contributes to household expenses with the help of her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy more shoes wholesale so she can continue with her business as it is their only source of income so she can give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
FOUSSEYNI  est âgé de 33 ans et vit avec ses deux enfants et ses époux dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
FOUSSEYNI   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 7 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de DANGASSA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, SANANKOROBA
FOUSSEYNI  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fousseyni is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba in the region of Koulikoro.  Fousseyni didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  Early on, he started looking for money making business ideas, especially the buying and selling of cereals.  

In order to satisfy the needs of his growing numbers of customers, Fousseyni works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  Having already fully repaid his third loan, this will be his fifth individual loan.  He will use his loan to buy seven tonnes of cereals from farmer producers in and around Dangassa.  He will then stock them for two months before selling them on, in bulk, to resale merchants from the large cities, such as Bamako and Sanankoroba.  

Fousseyni expects to earn a monthly average of 115,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, posee un negocio de venta de pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: chicharrón, frijoles, maíz, quesillo, aceite, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus padres.
texts.en: Ana is 30 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her parents.  She has been running a pupusa business out of her home for two years and this allows her to pay for some of her household expenses.  Ana is asking for this loan to buy ingredients, such as fried pork rinds, corn, cheese, cooking oil, etc., so she can continue her business, since this is her only source of income.  This way she and her parents can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.fr:
Née vers 1974 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KAROLINE vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite KAROLINE s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, telles  l’achat vente  des boissons, des denrées alimentaire et de la restauration. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les six prêts précédents, elle est à son septième prêt individuel. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt, 60  kilogrammes de condiments, une tonne de céréales, des tubercules et une quantité importante de boissons à des fins de restauration. 
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100. 000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir le reste dans les affaires.
Elle compte toujours sur l’appui financier de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’ouverture de nouveau restaurant en d’autre localité où le besoin se pose.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Ouelessebougou, Karoline lives with her husband and three children in a nuclear family in the rural area of Ouelessebougou.  

Unable to continue with her studies, Karoline looked for money making opportunities such as sale of drinks, basic foods and catering.  

She has fully repaid her first six loans, and this will be her seventh individual loan.  Karoline buys her supplies once a week in Bamako, and she will use this loan to buy 60kgs of ingredients, 1 tonne of cereals, tubers and a large quantity of drinks for her restaurant business.  

Karoline expects to earn a monthly average of 100,000 francs CFA which she will use to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.  in the future, she intends to use the services of the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso,  to open further restaurants in other areas as the need arises.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador de 45 años de edad, casado, con cuatro hijos bajo su cargo, se dedica al entrenamiento de caballos desde hace 11 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años. Está solicitando nuevamente crédito para la compra de caballos, alimentos, y herramientas para los entrenamientos.
texts.en: Carlos is a hardworking 45 year old man.  He is married, has four children, and has been training horses for 11 years.  He has been with the institution for two years and is asking for a loan to buy horses, feed, and training tools.

loans.use: to buy horses and feed.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie earns a living by making “Bibingka” and selling it on her own. She is 63 years old, a widow, and lives in Calacas, Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is now well known for the delicious and tasty “bibingka” she bakes. Her business is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 3000 per month.  

Rosie is seeking a Php 5,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase new materials used for baking and also some ingredients used in making the food. This is a microfinance loan, and would be repaid in a few  months. In her nine previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Rosie is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients for baking

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn  has two school aged children living with her.  She helps her husband make a living by managing their rice farm.  She has helped manage their farm for more than eight years. She would like a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer to improve the farm. She hopes to make a profit from her investments. In the future, Jocelyn wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth helps her husband in managing their rice farm to earn a living.  Her income from the farm is used to meet the needs of her four children.With her previous loan from GDMPC, she purchased fertilizer for the last crop and has successfully repaid the loan. 

Elizabeth is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for this season. She hopes to earn more of a return from the farm with this investment. In the future, Elizabeth wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Los Artesanos Group

texts.es: Carolina, quien se ubica en medio de la fotografía con lentes y un pañuelo burdeo en su cuello, participa en el Banco Comunal Los Artesanos, ubicado en Castro. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienen diversos negocios tales como venta de comida rápida, bazar, confección y venta de artesanía, grupos folclóricos. Carolina tiene un bazar, en el que vende también ropa nueva y reciclada. Comenzó hace 6 meses, y lo comenzó por la necesidad de estar cerca y disponible para sus pequeños hijos, es por esto que junto algunos ahorros y pudo instalarse con un pequeño negocio, como desafío se ha impuesto poder agrandar su negocio vendiendo bisutería también. Carolina necesita el dinero para poder comprar ropa nueva ya que se aproxima navidad y la gente que vive cerca de ella le ha pedido tener ropa nueva. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de conocer gente que tiene los mismos desafíos que ella.
texts.en: Carolina, who is located in the center of the photo, wearing glasses and a scarf, is a member of the Los Artesanos communal bank in Castro.  The members of this communal bank have different businesses such as fast food sales, paper goods, arts and craft making and sales, and folk dancing.  Carolina has a paper goods store and also sells new and used clothing there.  She started six months ago, out of a need to be near and available to her children, so she got some savings together and was able to set up a small business.  Her challenges are in expanding her business by also selling costume jewelry.  Carolina needs the money to buy new clothing, now that the Christmas season is approaching and people who live near her have requested new clothing.  What she has enjoyed most about Fondo Esperanza is that it has allowed her to get to know people who face the same challenges as she.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia manages her own retail business as an aid to her husband's income from farming. She sells used clothing, which she has been doing for more than two years. 

Basilia is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase more used clothing to sell. Her dream is to own a stall in the market where she could sell her stock to earn more for the family.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is helped her husband vending fish in the market to earn a living. She has been doing this business for more than five years, earning well for the family of five children. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more variety of seafood to resell. In the future, she wants to have their own fishing outfit  to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more variety of seafood to resell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is running a banana farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years, earning well enough for their daily living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy organic fertilizer to improve her harvest. In the future, Herminia wants to expand her banana farm to have a stable source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Francis Mileydis

texts.es:
