Francis tiene 31 años de edad, ella estudio bachillerato en computación pero no ejerció la profesión por las pocas fuentes de empleo que existen en la localidad con el paso del tiempo ella se casó y junto a su esposo  tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos el mayor es varón y tiene 6 años el cual acaba de terminar la preparatoria de kínder en un instituto de la comunidad y la niña solo tiene un año de nacida. Juntos se dedican al negocio del cultivo de café ya que desde niña ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra debido a que sus padres son agricultores y fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron como se cultiva el café. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 3 kilómetros al cual se trasladan caminando. También tiene dos manzanas de café que está en plantía pero este año empieza a dar su primera cosecha como dificultades que a ella se le pueden presentar e la alza de precios en la compra de insumos que son utilizados para mantener sus cultivos protegidos y en segundo lugar que el intermediario no le compre el café a un precio justo.

Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café por lo que como negocio es su única fuente de ingresos con la que por muchos años en su familia (padres, hermanos) ha sido importante y hoy día no es la excepción.

Francis como meta se propone comprar más tierra para seguir cosechando café para fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y poderle heredarle a cada uno de ellos un pedazo para que cuando estén grandes trabajen o construyan sus hogares, pero sus sueño es darles la oportunidad que se preparen a nivel universitario en carreras de provecho y de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old and has a bachelor’s degree in computing, but she did not go into this field because of the lack of sources of employment in her area.  Over time she got married and she and her husband have two children who live with them.  Their oldest son is 6 years old and just finished kindergarten at the local school; their daughter is only one year old.  Together they raise coffee and she learned to work the land when she was a little girl, because her parents were farmers and taught her how to raise coffee.

Her crops are located 3 km away and they walk there.  She also has two other plots of coffee and they are just now beginning to produce their first harvests.  Things that can cause her difficulties include the increase in price for supplies and the fact that the wholesaler does not pay a fair price for her coffee.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies to aid her crops, since this has been her only source of income, which has been important to her family (parents, siblings) for many years.  Today is no exception.

Francis’ goal is to buy more land so she can continue harvesting coffee, better provide for her children, and be able to bequeath a piece of land to each of them when they are old enough to work and form their own families.  Her dream is to provide them the opportunity to prepare for university and good, beneficial careers.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Кариму 52 года. Он уроженец района Б.Гафурова города Худжанда. Карим около 3 месяцев предоставляет услуги такси. Но он хочет заняться другой деятельностью. Сын Карима занимается продажей пряников на рынке "Панджшанбе" и Карим тоже хочет заняться продажей пряников. Он будет покупать сладости из города Худжанда, и перепродавать их в городе Исфары и Канибадам. Чтобы начать такую деятельность Кариму необходимо средства для покупки пряников, но к сожалению Кариму не хватает начального капитала. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Карим надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Karim is 52 and a native of the Bobojon Gafurov region of Khujand.  He's been providing taxi services for around three months but would like to engage in a different business.  His son sells spice cakes at the Panjshanbe Market and Karim would like to do the same.  He'll buy the cakes in the city of Khujand and resell them in the cities of Isfara and Kanibadam.  In order to start his business Karim needs the money to buy the spice cakes.  Unfortunately, he doesn't have the starting capital, so he is seeking a loan and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy spice cakes for resale.

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang and the Gayatri Indah Group continue their loans. This time, the loans are being used to purchase piglets for fattening. The group has a new member to replace the member who has already resigned. They are all very grateful for the loan they have received. Beside getting trained, they also received the loan without collateral, but they are very responsible for the loan.

Ni Komang will use the loan to purchase four piglets for fattening. Each piglet costs 400,000 IDR. She hopes the buying price for feed will be low and the sale price for pigs will be higher. She expects to earn more profits. Ni Komang has a dream of fixing her kitchen with the profit from the pig business.

Ni Komang is on the left side with her daughter sitting in front of her.

loans.use: to buy four piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo de 18 años de edad él estudia actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Ana está solicitando un crédito ya que con lo que gana no ha podido comprar más mercadería, por esa razón solicita el crédito y así poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder darle as u hijo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old and a single mother who lives in her own home with her 18 year old son.  He currently attends school and she has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years.  This allows her to pay her household expenses.  Ana is asking for a loan because she has not been able to buy more merchandise with what she earns.  This loan will allow her to buy more fruits and vegetables in quantity, so she can continue her business.  This is her only source of work and she can provide better financial stability for her son.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es: Claudia de 39 años de edad posee un negocio de venta de ropa en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, Claudia está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ropa por mayor como: blusas, faldas, camisas, shorts, pantalones, ropa para niños, etc. para poder surtir con mas mercadería y atender mejor a su clientes, y obtener mas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Claudia is 39 years old and has had a clothing business in her home for two years, with which she pays her household expenses.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband and 16 year old son who attends school.  Claudia is asking for a loan so she can buy clothing, such as blouses, skirts, shirts, shorts, pants, children’s clothing, etc. in quantity, so she can stock up with more merchandise and be able to better serve her customers, increase her income, and be able to provide her family with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: N'golo

texts.fr:
N’GOLO est âgé de 59 ans et vit avec ses dix enfants et ses époux dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
N’GOLO   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 7 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de FARABA DRACORO et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 1 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU
N’GOLO  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N'golo is 59 years old and lives with his wives and ten children in the sub-prefecture of Kourouba in the Koulikoro region.  

He didn't have the opportunity to go to school and, instead, looked for ways to make money.  He was particularly interested in the buying, storing and selling of cereals.  

In order to satisfy the needs of his growing numbers of customers, he began to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  He has fully repaid his third loan and this will be his fourth individual loan.  

N'golo will use his loan to buy seven tonnes of cereals from farmer producers in, and around, Faraba Dracoro.  He will then store the cereals for at least one month before selling them on to resale merchants from the big cities such as Bamako and Ouelessebougou.  N'golo expects to earn a monthly average of 120,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Douglas Alfredo

texts.es: Douglas de 32 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años especialmente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 11 años de edad, Douglas está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para poder seguir con su siembra y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Douglas is 32 years old, has been a farmer for several years, and raises different types of corn.  He pays his household expenses with the proceeds from his sales and lives in a home of his own with his life partner and 11 year old son.  Douglas is asking for a loan to buy compost, fertilizer, herbicide, blight control, etc. so that he can continue planting and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is 29 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 5 children.

Rodel works in the fishing industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for one year. He has requested a loan for additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

Rodel is a new member of PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Rodel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to retail

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Молодая женщина вместе со своей семьей живет бедно на северной части горного Таджикистна. Ее зовут Зарифа. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Зарифа имеет педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе учителем истории, но так как она получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения 3 детей, она начала свой бизнес выращиванием и продажей картошки и пшеницы. В ее регионе очень удобно выращивать картошку, так как земля и климат, подходящий для выращивания этого овоща. Зарифе помогает ее муж по введению бизнеса. Зарифа уже давно мечтает отремонтировать свой старый дом, который остался от родителей ее мужа. Она потратила все свои деньги для осеннего посева. Она не имеет денег для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This young woman lives with her family in poor conditions in the northern parts of mountainous Tajikistan. Her name is Zarifa. She is a clever and hardworking woman. Zarifa has a pedagogical education. She works in a middle school as a history teacher, but since she receives a small salary and this pay is not enough to support three children, she started her own business growing and selling potatoes and wheat. Her region is very good for growing potatoes, since the earth and climate are suitable for growing this vegetable. Zarifa is helped by her husband in running the business.

Zarifa has long been dreaming of repairing her old home, which was left by her husband's parents. She spent all her money on the fall planting. She does not have money to buy building materials to repair her home. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela helps her husband in running a 'buy and sell' business to earn a living. She buys assorted lumber and sells it in volume in town. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more coco lumber to resell. A portion will be used to repair her motorcycle used in the business. She is hopeful to gain more revenue from the business and able to provide the educational costs of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more coco lumber to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 58 years old and a widow. She has five children. She operates a business, making and selling rice cakes in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for nine years, and she earns well for her family's living.She joined GDMPC in 2011, and her previous loans used in the business have been successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan, which she used to purchase ingredients for making rice cakes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making rice cakes to sell.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza is 46 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Edeliza operates her own small restaurant. She earns about 2000 PHP each month doing this type of business. Edeliza has requested a loan to buy additional kilos of pork and chicken for her restaurant.

Edeliza is a new member of PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Edeliza would like to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of pork and chicken for her restaurant

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is married with two children. She is 50 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Reynalda owns a furniture-making business to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy wood and other materials.

Reynalda is a new member of PMPC this year 2013. In the future, Reynalda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Marieta operates her 'sari-sari' store to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7000 PHP for additional capital.

Marieta is a new member of PMPC this year, 2013. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda has been running her piggery for six years and she earns well for the needs of her five children and the entire family. Her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy feed has been successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional piglets to raise. She wants to make an expansion to her business and dreams of seeing her children finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma helps her husband in managing a transportation business to make a living. Her husband has been carrying passengers and baggage for six years, earning well for their needs. Her previous loan that was used in buying spare parts for motor repair has been successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan to buy new tires to bring safety to her business. In the future, she plans to acquire a new motorcycle for expansion.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old, married, and has children, four of whom attend school. She is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She and her husband manage their household as they both work hard for their family.

Rowena buys and sells charcoal. She buys big quantities of charcoal and then sells them per plastic or per sack. She also has a direct selling business and electronic loading station for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 550 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rowena is requesting a loan for 35,000 PHP, which she will be use to buy more stocks of charcoal and direct selling products. She dreams that her business will grow stronger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. 

Basilia meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and direct Sslling products.

loans.name: Tatiana Paola

texts.es: Tatiana es una joven emprendedora y dinámica, con tan solo 18 años de edad ya es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años por quien lucha incansablemente para sacarlo adelante, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios y, motivada por la necesidad de generar recursos económicos decidió montar su propio negocio, una pequeña cafetería en la que ofrece todo tipo de alimentos fritos como buñuelos, empanadas, pasteles de pollo, papas rellenas, gaseosas, entre otros y, de esta forma se ha ganado la vida y aunque las condiciones en las que vive no son las mejores, es feliz con su pequeño bebé. Su empuje, actitud positiva y su perseverancia la motivan a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, masa para buñuelos, salsas, pasteles, mecato, entre otros), de esta manera podrá tener disponibilidad de mayor cantidad de productos para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta especialmente en la temporada de fin de año, permitiéndole mejorar las ventas y obtener mayor nivel de utilidades, lo que para Tatiana significa tener la oportunidad de seguir avanzando y cumplir el sueño de tener su propio negocio de comidas rápidas en un local más amplio, en el que pueda atender mayor flujo de personas; de esta manera estaría en la capacidad de estabilizar su economía y brindarle a su hijo un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a young, dynamic, and enterprising woman.  Even though she is only 18 years old, she is the single mother of a 2 year old boy and works tirelessly to get him ahead, since she doesn’t get support from his father.  When she completed her middle school studies, motivated by a need to generate an income, she decided to start her own business, a small café where she sells all sorts of fried foods, such as buñuelos, empanadas, chicken pies, stuffed potatoes, soft drinks, and other things.  She has earned a living this way and even though her living conditions are not the best, she is happy with her baby boy.

Her drive, positive attitude, and perseverance motivated her to ask for this loan so she can buy inventory in quantity (soft drinks, dough to make buñuelos, salsas, pies, pastries, etc.) and have many items on hand to satisfy her increasing customer demand, especially at year’s end.  This will allow for greater sales and profit, which will allow Tatiana to continue to get ahead and fulfill her dream of having her own fast food business in a larger place where she can serve a greater number of customers.  In this way she can be better off financially and be able to provide for her son’s wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Rosa Group

texts.es: Doña Irma es integrante de Banco Mujer La Rosa, tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de de ellos en secundaria y el menor aún no entra a primaria. Esta señora tan trabajadora, es la costurera de su comunidad, confecciona ropa a la medida y también set de baño, cortinas y ropa de cama. Este es el sexto crédito que solicita y los anteriores le permitieron comprar la maquinaria con la que hoy cuenta. Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones entre esas están mejorar las condiciones de su casa que está en mal estado y seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Con Irma está una compañera más que va a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the La Rosa Ladies’ Bank.  She is 43 years old, married, and has two children; the oldest is middle school aged and the youngest has not yet started elementary school.  This hardworking woman is a seamstress in her community and makes clothing to measure, bath sets, curtains, and bed clothing.

This will be her sixth loan and the previous ones allowed her to buy her sewing machine.  She has many aspirations, including improving the conditions in her home, which is in poor state.  She also wants to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.  One of Irma’s fellow members, who wants to invest in business activities, is shown with her.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier de 23 años de edad tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad donde vende bolsos viajeros, escolares maletas, carrieles etc. Su idea provino de su padre quien tiene el mismo negocio desde hace más de 15 años y Manuel lo ayudaba a partir de sus 13 años de edad. Por eso hace 5 años, su padre le cedió un puesto comercial,  que hoy surte con mercancía variada y donde llegan sus clientes para hacerle su compra.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, así como sus compras. Él tiene proveedores en un municipio fronterizo y en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén para distribuir en mayor volumen y casa propia donde su cónyuge y sus futuros hijos puedan vivir plácidamente. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará maletas, bolsos, carrieles, lo cual le permite aumentar sus inventarios para la temporada de vacaciones que se acerca y con ello aumentar sus ganancias y esto es justamente lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Javier is 23 years old and has a business in the city center, where he sells luggage, school bags, leather cases, etc.  He got this idea from his father, who has had a similar business for more than 15 years and Manuel helped him since age 13, so his father gave him his shop five years ago, which he now stocks with a variety of merchandise, and where his customers arrive to make their purchases.

He makes his sales and purchases for cash and credit and has suppliers at a border town and in the city of Barranquilla.  His future goals are to have a store so that he can sell greater volume and to have a home of his own where his wife and future children can live placidly.

He is asking for a Kiva loan, his first through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy suitcases, bags, leather cases, which will allow him to increase his inventory for the approaching holiday season, and increase his income.  This is what he will do with his Kiva loan to be successful.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut, head of the Sari Karya group, is leading her members to receive their eighth loan. They choose a new Secretary and are continuing the group with 14 members and a total loan of 22,400,000 IDR. Every time the group sell the pigs, they set aside an amount for savings. They hope they can have enough savings and run the business independently with the savings.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase 3 piglets for fattening. She will sell them after 6 months. Ni Ketut has a plan to build a new cage beside the old cage and she hopes she can increase the population of her pigs.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es madre de tres hijos pero actualmente solo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Ana, consiste en el la venta de diferentes productos de forma ambulatoria, entre las cosas que vende, ofrece juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y otras cosas mas que usan como accesorios sobre todo para las niñas, sale a diario en busca de sus clientes para ofrecer sus buenos y novedosos productos.  Lleva trabajando con ésta actividad por más de 04 años, lo hace sola y aunque ahora está muy bien preparada para hacer su trabajo, comenta que cuando empezó tuvo muchas dificultades como el no saber que estrategia usar para llegar al cliente, ahora es muy buena en lo que hace y día a día se supera mas y mas. 
Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado 300 soles, comprar mercadería, entre las cosas que comprará tenemos juguetes, collares, pulseras y otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 and is a good, kind woman. She is the mother of three children, although at the moment she is living with only two of them, in her own house. Her work consists of selling different products as a street vendor. She sells items such as toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets and other accessories, especially items for girls. She goes out each day looking for customers to offer her good-quality, original products. She has been doing this work for more than 4 years. She works alone, and although she is now more prepared for her work, she comments that when she started off she encountered a lot of difficulties, as she didn’t know which strategies to use to appeal to her customer base. Now she is very good at what she does, and she is constantly improving each day.

This is Ana’s sixth Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial support that she has received to keep going. In addition, she promises to make punctual repayments. She will use the loan of 300 soles to buy goods such as toys, necklaces, bracelets and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy goods such as toys, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Né en Décembre 1978 à Fakola, MAHAMADOU y  réside  avec sa femme et ses  enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr MAHAMADOU  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de parures de femmes, de téléphones portables et accessoires et des habits. Il est très sollicité au marché de Fakola et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 4 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier prêt individuel. MAHAMADOU  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des articlés divers : parures et pagnes. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché essentiellement à  une clientèle mixte.
MAHAMADOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in December 1978 in Fakola, MAHAMADOU resides there with his wife and children in a traditional family. He quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of women's accessories, mobile phones and accessories, and clothing. He is much in demand at the Fakola market and particularly on market days. With a good four years of experience in this domain, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to increase his capital in order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base. He is on his first individual loan. 

MAHAMADOU intends to use his loan to purchase a variety of goods:  accessories and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). He gets his supplies from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash and sometimes credit, he makes his sales at the market essentially to a mixed customer base. MAHAMADOU hopes to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to resell

loans.name: Oykiz

texts.ru: Ойкиз живет в районе Шахритус. Она вместе с мужем занимается земледелием. На 0,12 га участке земли они выращивают сельскохозяйственную культуру. Ойкиз 46 лет, имеет детей. Она планирует начать одновременно семейный животноводческий бизнес. Процесс ее будущего бизнеса будет выглядеть таким образом. Ее муж и старший сын будут закупать крупнорогатый скот с местного скотного рынка. Ойкиз сама будет выращивать и откармливать коров и телят, а через месяц ее муж и сын будут реализовать скот на том же рынке по прибыльной цене. Для осуществления задуманного Ойкиз обратилась за кредитом. Она собирается купить 4-х голов коров и телят. Корм для скота Ойкиз будет брать со своего земельного участка. Сейчас она уже запаслась более 250 вязкой кукурузной травы.
texts.en: Oykiz lives in the Shahrituz district.  Together with her husband, she is involved in farming.  They grow agricultural crops on a 1.12 hectare of land.  Oykiz is 46 years old and has children.  She plans to concurrently start a family business in animal husbandry.  The process of her future business will look like this.  Her husband and older son will buy cattle at a local livestock market.  Oykiz will raise and feed cows and calves herself, and in a month her husband and son will sell livestock at the same market at a profitable price.  Oykiz requested this loan to achieve this goal.  She plans to buy 4 cows and calves.  Oykiz will obtain the livestock feed from her land.  She already stored up over 250 stocks of corn plants.

loans.use: to buy 4 cows and calves

loans.name: Sector Martinez Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores exitosos uno de ellos es Jonathan tiene la edad de 24 años, casado, su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado en un tramo del mercado de Granada desde hace 1 año, Solicita crédito para invertir en comprar mercadería como pantalones hollister, pantalones jingo, pantalones Quik silver, big time. Julia tiene la edad de 54 años su negocio es la costura y  bordados, Hayssel tiene la edad de 25 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Mirna mujer de 49 años  su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie.
texts.en: This group was formed by a group of successful entrepreneurs.  Johnathen is one of them.  He is 24 years old, married, and has been selling clothing and shoes at the market in Granada for a year.  He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as Hollister, Jingo, Quick Silver, and Big Time pants.  Julia is 54 years old and works as a seamstress and embroiderer.  Hayssel is 25 years old and sells clothing.  Mirna is 49 years old and butchers hogs.

loans.use: to buy pants.

loans.name: Zafiro Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias luchadoras y trabajadoras una de ellas es Thelma mujer de 48 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 30 años, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de frutas como tamarindo, pago de mozo y transporte. Francis mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Juana mujer de 37 años su negocio es la venta de pan.
texts.en: This group is made up of three hardworking ladies.  Thelma is one of them.  She is 48 years old, single, and has two children under her care.  She has been selling fruit for the past 30 years and she is asking for this loan to buy fruit such as tamarind, and also pay for help and transportation.  Francis is 29 and sells clothing.  Juana is 37 and sells bread.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married and a mother of two  children. She manages her business making furniture and sells it in town, earning well for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC in buying materials and has successfully repaid it. Her business is running well and she needs more capital, for it has increased demands. She borrowed a new loan  to purchase additional materials for furniture making. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. One is high school and the other is married already. Her husband is a farmer and owns a small parcel of land. Estella has engaged in clothing sales (Ready To Wear consignment basis) and earns a monthly income of 2500 PHP. She has been in this business for three years. She has been a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC for two years and hopefully she could be able to repay her loan on time so she could access a larger amount next time.

loans.use: To buy additional Ready To Wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 34 years old. She is married and has one high school student. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in Pob. Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. 

Maridel has been running a small restaurant and earns a monthly income of 4,000 PHP. She requested a new loan to purchase five kilos of meat and various ingredients to make food to sell to customers. 

Maridel has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for four years. She aims to accumulate more savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 5 kilos of meat and various ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with three children and helps her husband to  manage their own farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for more than  five years, earning well enough for their daily living. Her previous loan that was used for weeding maintenance has been successfully repaid. 

Currently, she borrowed a new loan to pay the labor costs of replanting banana trees. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to pay the labor costs of replanting banana trees

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to Saturnino, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Lina is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the sack or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business.

Lina hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of rice for her business.

loans.name: Sentimientos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sentimientos está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de vegetación, cuenta con grandes paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable y gentil quienes trabajan a diario en diferentes fuetes de trabajos las mismas que le dan la oportunidad de mejorar su estabilidad económica, cada día es una oportunidad para crecer y mejorar, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en compañía de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Sentimientos, le gusta mucho esta forma de créditos ya que le dan la oportunidad de estrechar su amistad con las compañeras y platicar ya que muchas veces por el trabajo no se ven. 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y su último hijo en la escuela, su esposo labora como mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Rosa pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para aportar en la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, esto lo realiza todos los días y en cualquier momento que se le dé la oportunidad, también se dedica a realizar tejidos como chompas, carteras que las vende muchas veces a sus clientes de los cosméticos, esta actividad la aprendió por habilidad. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de hilos y cosméticos de oferta. Su meta es tener su propia tienda.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Sentimientos” [Feelings] and is composed of six women and two men. They all live in Cuenca, a city surrounded by vegetation and with great landscapes due to its rough geography. There are four rivers flowing through it, and it was declared World Cultural Heritage Site in December 1999. Its people are kind and courteous and work every day with different activities through which they have the opportunity to improve their economic situation. Every new day is a new opportunity to grow and improve. They keep alive the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Rosa. This is her third loan together with her friends who are also members of this group. She likes this type of credit because she has the opportunity to strengthen her friendship with the rest of the members and to have a chat, since they are normally busy with work and cannot meet. Rosa is 39, married and has two children who are 12 and 7. Her first son goes to upper school, the youngest, to elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic. They live in a rented house.

Rosa is a stay-at-home mom. However, she contributes to the household’s economy by selling cosmetics from different brands, every day and at any time if it is needed. She also weaves sweaters and purses and sells them to the same customers that buy cosmetics. She had talent for business and learned by doing.

With this loan she will buy threads and cosmetic products that are on sale. Her goal is to have her own establishment.

Two members could not be there when the picture was taken, so their pictures were added afterwards.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and threads.

loans.name: María Bersabe

texts.es:
María de 70 años de edad,  es madre de 6 hijos todos mayores  de edad; ella no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar,  es acompañada  y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, solo tres hijos están en casa, uno trabaja de albañil y el otro en el tren de aseo del municipio y una hija que es enferma. 

María tiene el negocio de  la elaboración y venta de tamales, ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este oficio,  lo aprendió de la mamá ya que ella siempre le inculco el negocio y esto de los tamales era una buena opción a seguir en el negocio, para que tuviera ganancias. Ella no tiene otra fuente de ingresos, que solo en la elaboración de tamales de gallina en este negocio le ayuda las nueras en hacerlos,  pero solo ella sale a vender por todo el pueblo se levanta a las 3 de la mañana a coser el maíz y hacer todas las preparaciones,  para cuando ya va amaneciendo los tamales ya estén cosidos para que sirvan para el desayuno a las personas que los compran

El préstamo solicitado a Fundación Campo,  es para comprar hojas para envolver los tamales y comprara las preparaciones para elaborarlos y salir a vender más,  ya que las personas cuando la ven le preguntan cuándo va hacer tamales para comprarles ya que por la experiencia que tiene,  los clientes se los tiene ganados. 

El préstamo le ayudara en los ingresos económicos a casa, ya que solo del trabajo que realiza su esposo en la agricultura le es difícil y en ocasiones que le salen trabajos de albañil, es cuando hay ingresos y ella tiene que luchar para tener dinero para comprarle la medicina a la hija que está enferma.

Su sueño, es seguir haciendo tamales hasta que ya no se pueda levantarse,  porque para ella es una diversión salir a vender aparte de las ganancias y los ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
Maria, 70, is the mother of 6 children who have all reached adulthood. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She lives with her husband and they work in agriculture. Only 3 of her children remain in her home. One son is a construction worker, the other son works on a waste collection truck, and her daughter is ill. 

Maria is in the business of making and selling tamales, a craft she has done for 20 years. She learned how to make tamales from her mother who always instilled that creating a business selling tamales was a good choice to remain in business and earn profits. She has no other source of income besides making chicken tamales. Her daughter-in-law helps her to make the tamales but only Maria goes out to sell them to their neighborhood. She wakes at three in the morning to cook the corn and do all of the preparations. When the tamales are all ready, she serves them as breakfast to her customers.


The loan she has applied to from Fundación Campo is to buy leaves to wrap the tamales and the ingredients for making them so she can prepare more and go out to sell more tamales. She is going to gain more clients because customers have been asking when she is going to make tamales so they can buy them and because she has experience.

The loan will help the household income as the only work done by her husband is in agriculture which is difficult. On occasion, he gets work in construction jobs which is when there is an income. She has to struggle to obtain money to purchase the medicine for her daughter who is sick.

Her dream is to continue making tamales until she can no longer stand upright because for her it is fun for her to sell apart from the earning and income she obtains.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make and wrap tamales in order to go out and sell more.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né en Décembre 1986 à Kadiana  commune de Kadiana, BAKARY y  réside avec sa femme et ses  enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr BAKARY  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des téléphones et accessoires. Il est très sollicité au marché de Kadiana, et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt individuel. BAKARY compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des téléphones et accessoires. il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché.
BAKARY espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Kadiana (in Commune de Kadiana), BAKARY resides there with his wife and children in a traditional family. He quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of telephones and accessories. He is much in demand at the Kadiana market particularly on market days. 

With a good three years of experience in this domain, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to increase his capital in order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base. He is on his first individual loan. 

BAKARY intends to use his loan to purchase telephones and accessories. He gets his supplies from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash and sometimes credit, he makes his sales at the market. BAKARY hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né vers1977 à Banasso (arrondissement de Fourou), MOUSSA  réside à Kadiana avec  sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire.
 Mr MOUSSA  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat   vente d’articles divers. il est très sollicité au marché de Kadiana et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 8 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième prêt, après avoir remboursé les prêts précédents. 
MOUSSA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pile, sucre, cigarettes, thé et conserves. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de Bamako et effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché.
MOUSSA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Banasso (Fourou district), MOUSSA resides in Kadiana with his wife and children in a nuclear family. He quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of various goods. He is much in demand at the Kadiana market and particularly on market days. 

With a good eight years of experience in this domain, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to increase his capital in order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base. He is on his fourth individual loan after having repaid the previous ones. 

MOUSSA intends to use his loan to purchase batteries, sugar, cigarettes, tea, and canned foods. He gets his supplies from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash and sometimes credit, he makes his sales at the market. MOUSSA hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to resell

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter de 42 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el arroz y el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia, Walter esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Walter is 42 years old and has worked in agriculture for several years. His main crops are rice and corn and he sells his produce around the area where he lives. With the money he makes from his sales he is able to cover some of his household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family. 

Walter is asking for a loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, fungicides etc. so he can continue growing his crops and so make better profits which will help him to give his family absolutely everything they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, fungicides etc.

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Né vers 1977 à Fakola  (cercle de  Kolondièba), SALI y  réside  avec son marie et ses 2 enfants dans une famille nucléaire.
 Mme SALI  s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’attiéké. Elle est très sollicitée au marché de Fakola et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 5 années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
SALI  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une importante quantité d’attiéké. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de Fakola et Guèya. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant. SALI  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  augmenter  son capital et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Fakola, in the Kolondièba district, Sali lives with her husband and their two children in a nuclear family.  

Sali is involved in revenue generating businesses, specifically buying and selling attiéké (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous).  She is very popular at the local market and at fairs.  

With the benefit of her five years of experience,  she works with the field partner Soro Yiriwaso to improve her business income and satisfy the growing demands of her customers.  

This will be Sali's second loan, the first loan was fully and correctly repaid.  She will use her loan to buy a large amount of attiéké.  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Fakola and Guèya, and sells her products on a cash basis.  

Sali expects to earn 75,000 francs CFA a month and will use her earnings to increase her business capital and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy attiéké (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous).

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old, married, and has one child. Jenny and her husband operate a transportation business.

Jenny is requesting a loan for 7.000 PHP, which she will use to pay for repairs and maintenance of vehicles and to purchase feeds and medicine for hogs. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and earn more profits so she will have a secure future.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of vehicles and to purchase feeds and medicine for hogs

loans.name: Jorito

texts.en:
Jorito is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. He is a responsible father who aims to improve their living conditions.  Aside from farming, he operates a motorcycle transport business to generate additional income.  

Due to lack of capital Jorito is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy gasoline, sprocket, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that the loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, sprocket, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 61 years old; she is a widow and has seven adult children. She lives in Lusot Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

Anita has been the rice farming business for 25 years, and earned a monthly income of 4,000. 

She requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and pesticides. 

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years. She wishes she could have more savings from her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín de 40 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz, tiene 2 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo  prefieren  por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; él necesita invertir en la siembra por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Benjamín tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Benjamin is 40-years-old and lives with his wife and children in their own home. He makes his living cultivating corn and rice. He has worked in agriculture for two years which have given him a lot of experience that allows him to get the best crops. He sells his harvests in the markets around his community and his has many customers who prefer his products' quality, good prices, and above all, the good service he gives. He needs to invest in planting so he requested a loan that allows him to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc. Benjamin has good references for his capability to repay from his acquaintances. He is very responsible and ensures he can pay off the debt within the prescribed period. He hopes to improve his household's economic security.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, and more for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49, married, and has three children. She has been engaged in a hog fattening business for over three years, earning an income of PHP 5,000 when she sells some hogs. Her income was usually spent on their daily expenditures and electric bills. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins to increase her usual income. 

She hopes for the approval of her loan request to improve and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins to increase her income.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 38 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has three children.

Francisca works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy more fish to sell. Francisca is a new member of PMPC this year. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin manages her general store, and was able to sustain her family's living needs. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to purchase rice and corn grits has successfully repaid. 

Currently, she took a new loan to purchase additional corn grits to resell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn grits to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de comerciante de api, cafe, te y otros. Isabel necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion, comprara cemento, estuco y otros para refaccionar un par de habitaciones en su vivienda y así tener una mejor calidad de vida

El sueño Isabel es terminar de refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel lives in her own home, which is made of bricks and has a cement floor. Her house is located in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. She works as a merchant who sells "api" (a warm beverage made from corn), coffee, tea, and other products.

Isabel needs a loan so that she can buy construction materials. She plans to buy cement, stucco, and other supplies so that she can repair two rooms in her home. This will give her a better quality of life. Isabel's dream is to finish the repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, stucco, and other supplies in order to repair two rooms.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is married and has four children. She is 67 years old and lives in Sta Cruz, Tangub City. Primitiva sells shoes to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 12,000 doing this work.

Primitiva has requested a loan for 14,900 to buy another bundle of shoes to sell, which will increase her available products to be sold. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Primitiva hopes to expand her business and plans to open another store.

loans.use: to pay for another bundle of shoes to sell

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 55 years old and a widow. She is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. With capital of 3,000 PHP, she started operating a sari-sari store (general store) to earn an income. 

In 2011, Lolita applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Currently, Lolita is asking for financial assistance of 14,900 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is a 61-year-old married man with three sons and one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Hung earns money from his business of repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for six years. Now, Hung would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Esquil Lizande

texts.es:
Esquil Lizande tiene 33 años de edad vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería como fuente de ingreso principal, a dos horas de ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su madre se dedican al comercio de granos en su domicilio, El realiza labores agrícolas en su finca de frutales, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar abono para los cultivos de plátano y maíz y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Esquil Lizande is 33 years old and lives with his mother in the District of Morropon. His town is known for agriculture and livestock breeding as the main sources for generating income. It is also located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

With the help of his mother, he sells grain from his home. He also works on his own farm. Esquil Lizande is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN in order to buy compost for his banana and corn crops so that he can produce more that he can sell to his customers. As a result, he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost for his banana and corn crops.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Señor  Andrés tiene 56 años, él se dedica a al servicio de transporte él es moto taxista  el brinda el servicio en la localidad de El torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Andrés  va a usar este préstamo para compra de una motocicleta su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de poder brindar un mejor servicio ya que la motocicleta que tenía está presentando algunas fallas que no le permite realizar su trabajo de buena manera, el Señor  Andrés enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida  de su familia y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar una televisión para su casa, el  Señor  Andrés es una persona responsable se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Andres is 56 years old. He works providing motorcycle taxi service in the locality of El Torno. This is Andres’s first loan with the field partner. He will use it to buy a new motorcycle, which he says that he needs in order to provide better service to his customers. Andres says that the motorcycle he has now has developed some problems that make it difficult for him to provide reliable service to his customers.

Andres says that the challenges he faces with his business are improving his income and his family’s quality of life. He plans to use the profit from his business to buy a television for his home. Andres is described as a responsible person. He says that he feels happy for the opportunity that lenders give him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita works hard to support her family. Bernadita is married and has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Bernadita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell. Bernadita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Bernadita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dasa

texts.en:
Dasa is 48 years old and married with six children.

Dasa earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dasa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries. Dasa has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Dasa is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and married. She has five children who are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Analyn has been farming rice for 4 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel es originario de la ciudad de Teustepe y padre de un hijo. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles además a la crianza de ganado. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito por que ha logrado obtener ganancias de la venta de sus terneros. Solicita el crédito para comprar dos terneros con el fin de incrementar aún más sus ingresos y garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. Estima que el crédito le ayudará adquirir ganancias para poder comprar un terreno y asegurarle una  vivienda digna a su hijo.
texts.en:
Daniel is originally from the city of Teustepe and is father to a 3-year-old son. He is a farmer and grows corn and beans in addition to raising livestock. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for allowing him to obtain profits from the sale of his lands. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase two plots of land in order to increase still his income and guarantee a better quality of life for his family. He hopes the loan will help procure profits to be able to purchase land and secure a respectable dwelling for his son.

loans.use: to purchase two plots of land.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is 54 years old and married with 5 sons. She and her husband support their family by selling steamed thin rice pancakes with pork pies in her local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business which will enable her to buy beverages and a better quality and larger quantity of food ingredients and food, such as pork pies, to sell from her stall. 

Nam hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food ingredients and food, such as pork pies, to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui, 52, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including five sons and her husband. Mui and her husband earn money through their business producing shoes and slippers. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to make shoes and slippers so that she can increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy material to make shoes and slippers

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 58-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City.  She has three children.  She and her husband earn a living by running a general store, which they have done for nine years. 

Hanh would like to take out a loan in order to buy both a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as cooking oil and confectionery, to stock her general store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers as well as to attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, allowing her to improve her family's living conditions and enabling her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as cooking oil and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 52 years old.  She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters and her husband.  Mai and her husband earn money through their business, selling meals in front of her door.  

Mai would like to take out a loan in order to buy better food to serve to people in her community.  She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have both a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy better food to serve people in her community.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 51-year-old married woman.  She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.  For 26 years, she and her husband have made brooms by hand.

Nhung would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of materials needed to make brooms in order to help her better serve existing and attract new customers.  She also hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 48 years old and married with 2 sons. She and her husband support their family by selling soft-drinks in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business which will enable her to buy a larger quantity of soft-drinks to sell. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is a 66 year old, married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has 2 sons and one daughter. He and his wife earn a living running a business of making cardboard packaging. They have done this for 20 years. 

Ha would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of paper, cardboard and materials to increase his production of cardboard packaging. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of paper and materials to make cardboard packaging.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 57 years old and married with one son and two daughters. She and her husband support their family by selling meals in the local community. 

Lien would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business which will enable her to buy beverages and better food, such as meat and noodles, to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and better food, such as meat and noodles, to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: Doña Verónica se encuentra muy feliz, muy satisfecha porque gracias al apoyo que le brindo la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA, ella pudo comprar los insumos que sus cultivos necesitaban para poder estar limpios y sanos de plagas. Junto a su esposo y sus hijos pudieron aplicar el abono, foliar, insecticida, urea, etc. Como también limpiar de maleza sus cultivos aprovechando al máximo el financiamiento pudiendo obtener 50 cargas de maíz los cuales fueron vendidos a muy buen precio en la zona donde ella habita con los vecinos, familiares e intermediarios de la zona. Ahora gracias al apoyo recibido ellos decidieron aumentar su producción para poder vender al mercado local en donde podrán obtener otro ingreso mayor ya que aumentaron el área de cultivo con el apoyo del primer financiamiento recibido por la cooperativa COMIXMUL. En cuanto a otros ciclos su experiencia la lleva a una mejor vida social por lo que hoy nuevamente ha solicitado un nuevo financiamiento con el cual prepararan la tierra y cultivaran productos no tradicionales son cultivos de exportación donde logran obtener mayores ingresos como la siembra de maíz guayape.
texts.en:
Veronica is very happy and very satisfied because of the support that COMIXMUL cooperative along with Kiva lenders have provided her. She can purchase supplies needed for her crops in order for them to be clean and healthy from pests. With her husband and her children they were able to spread manure, plant fertilizer, insecticide, urea etc... as well as clean weeds from the crops maximizing the funding. They were able to obtain 50 loads of corn which were sold at a very good price in the area where she lives with her neighbours, family and intermediaries in the area. 

Now, thanks to the support she has received, she has decided to increase production to be able to sell at local markets where she can obtain more revenue as she has increased her cultivation area with the help of the first financing received through COMIXMUL cooperative. 

For other cycles, her experience had lead her to a better life which today, she can request another loan to prepare the land and cultivate non-traditional products, export crop where they can receive larger revenues such as the planting of Guayape corn.

loans.use: to prepare her land and cultivate a new product, Guayape corn.

loans.name: Elsy Dadeira

texts.es: Elsy, a sus 40 años de edad, es una mujer casada y madre de dos hijos. Durante la mayor parte de su vida productiva trabajó como empleada en una empresa de apuestas, desempeñándose como vendedora de loterías y juegos de azar, después de un tiempo se independizó y se dedicó a vender tamales y embutidos de manera ambulante y adicionalmente vendía productos por catálogo, pero viendo la aceptación que tienen estos artículos decidió dedicarse de lleno a esta actividad, pues deja buena ganancia; lo que para ella significa tener mejores ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La microempresaria se caracteriza por ser una persona carismática, pujante y trabajadora, su espíritu de superación la motivan a solicitar el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (cosméticos, cremas corporales, perfumería, accesorios, entre otros) y productos nutricionales (multi vitamínicos, malteadas, suplementos dietarios), de esta forma podrá aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado, con lo que los costos de los productos disminuyen, ocasionando un incremento en el margen de ganancia por cada venta, adicionalmente desea incursionar con la venta de productos nutricionales aprovechando la ventaja de que en el mercado actual se venden con facilidad, pues las personas se están preocupando más por cuidar su salud y la figura corporal, de esta manera podrá mejorar notablemente sus ingresos económicos. Elsy sueña con fortalecer su negocio y en un futuro poder montar su propio club de nutrición, ubicado en un local en el que pueda incrementar el nivel de ventas y percibir mejores ingresos de dinero para suplir las necesidades de su familia y así brindarles un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elsy, 40, is married and mother to two children. During most her life she has worked as an employee in a gambling establishment, selling lottery and games of chance. After some time, she began working for herself, she became a street vendor selling tamales and deli meats as well as selling products from a catalogue. Seeing acceptation with these products she decided to work full time in this activity as it provides a good income. For her it meant better revenues which in turn she could contribute to the household income. 

The microenterprise describes her as a person who is charismatic, driven and hard working. Her desire to better herself motivated her to request a loan to purchase merchandise at wholesale (cosmetic, body lotion, perfume, accessories among others) and nutritional products (multi-vitamins, shakes, dietary supplements). This way she can take advantage of the discounts when purchasing in bulk, causing an increase in margin per sale. In addition, she wishes to enter in the sale of nutritional products taking advantage of the current market; these products are sold easily, as people are interested in taking care of their health and figure. This way she can improve her income significantly.

Elsy dreams of strengthening her business and in the future be able to start her own Health Club located in a place where she can increase her sales and get more revenue to provide her family’s needs and give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise at wholesale (cosmetics, body lotion, perfume, accessories among others) and nutritional products (multi-vitamins, shakes, dietary supplements).

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion plants and harvests corn and other root crops for sale. She has been doing this to aid her family's daily needs. Her previous loan from GDMPC was successfully repaid. Currently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to expand her garden. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 51 years old.  She is married and has eight children, four of whom are still studying.  She lives in Siloy, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband is also a farmer. 

Feliciana has engaged in a gardening business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP.  She has requested a new loan in order to purchase one sack of fertilizer and vegetable seedlings.  She became a member of Paglaum MPC just this year, hoping that she could save more money from her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 49 years old and lives in Lumbia District, Pagadian City.  She is widowed and has five children.

Priscilla sells balut (a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell) to earn a living.  She has been in this business for four years.  She has requested a loan to buy additional trays of eggs for her balut vending business.

Priscilla has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Priscilla hopes to have a poultry farm of her own.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs for her balut vending business.

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa mujer luchadora de 70 años de edad, viuda, su negocio es la venta de variedades como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y electrodomésticos desde hace 29 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años, lo cual ha demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable en sus cuotas. Está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería como camisas de vestir, blusas, pantalones, shores, zapatos cerrados, sandalias, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas corporales, crema para peinar, cremas faciales, shampoo, etc.
texts.en:
Teresa is a determined woman who is 70 years old and widowed. Her business involves selling a variety of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and household appliances. She has been in business for 29 years and has been a client of ADIM for four years. Teresa has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her payments.

The new loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as dress shirts, blouses, trousers, shorts, closed-toe shoes, sandals, perfumes, deodorants, body creams, detangling creams, face creams, shampoo, and other products.

loans.use: to buy dress shirts, blouses, trousers, shorts, closed-toe shoes, sandals, perfumes, deodorants, body creams, detangling creams, face creams, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau, 36, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Chau and her husband have been in business for twelve years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu, 34, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband works in a factory in the local community. She earns money through her food stall by selling meals for people in her community. She started this business three years ago. She would like to get a loan to increase her working capital and buy raw ingredients and rice with better quality to make different meals to satisfy her customers' demands. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy rice and raw ingredients to make food to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi, 41, lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money through processing brass items. Loi supports her family by selling rice and sewing clothes. She started these business activities nine years ago. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of rice to sell at her store. Loi also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell
